Title: Eric Northman
Content: Eric Northman est un personnage fictif dans "The Southern Vampire Mysteries", une série de treize livres écrits par l'auteur à succès de "New York Times" Charlaine Harris. Il a un vampire, un peu plus de mille ans, et est présenté pour la première fois dans le premier roman, "Dead to Dark" et apparaît dans tous les romans suivants. Étant donné que la série de livres est racontée du point de vue de la première personne de Sookie Stackhouse, ce que les lecteurs perçoivent de son personnage sont influencés par ce que Sookie comprend. La série télévisée de HBO "True Blood" est basée sur cette série de livres et le personnage d'Eric Northman est représenté quelque peu différemment. Document ID: 2
Title: Emily Stackhouse
Content: Sometime in the mid 1840s, the botanist Charles Alexander Johns saw Stackhouse's watercolours and asked her to provide illustrations for a series of popular natural history books that he was publishing through the Society for Promoting Christian Knowledge. The first two were "Forest Trees of Britain" (1847) and "A Week at the Lizard" (1848, focusing on the Lizard peninsula in Cornwall); in both, some of the illustrations were engravings based on watercolours by Stackhouse, uncredited, but signed 'E.S.' This was followed by Johns's best-known book, "Flowers of the Field", published in two volumes in 1851 with over 200 uncredited illustrations by Stackhouse. Referred to as "the bible of the amateur botanist," its success was such that it went into more than 50 editions and was still in print a century after it first came out. In addition, after Johns and Stackhouse were dead, the SPCK continued to use Stackhouse's images in other books; it is estimated that they had been printed in at least 15 and as many as 30 different books by the end of the 19th century.

Title: Bengale

Le delta du Gange provient de la confluence des rivières des rivières, Brahmapoutre et Meghna Rivers et leurs affluents respectifs. La superficie totale du Bengale est de 232 752 km - l'ouest du Bengale est et du Bangladesh.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: History of Bangladesh
Content: The decision to effect the Partition of Bengal was announced in July 1905 by the Viceroy of India, Lord Curzon. The partition took place on 16 October 1905 and separated the largely Muslim eastern areas from the largely Hindu western areas. The former province of Bengal was divided into two new provinces "Bengal" (comprising western Bengal as well as the province of Bihar and Orissa) and Eastern Bengal and Assam with Dacca as the capital of the latter. Partition was promoted for administrative reasons: Bengal was geographically as large as France and had a significantly larger population. Curzon stated the eastern region was neglected and under-governed. By splitting the province, an improved administration could be established in the east, where subsequently, the population would benefit from new schools and employment opportunities. The Hindus of West Bengal who dominated Bengal's business and rural life complained that the division would make them a minority in a province that would incorporate the province of Bihar and Orissa. Indians were outraged at what they recognised as a "divide and rule" policy.
---

Content: With the loss of the church Masses were moved to St. Joseph's Orphanage till a new church could be built. Saturday & Sunday masses were held at Bishop Connolly High School. When the ruins were searched it was found that very little remained from the fire. One stained-glass window, "The Flight into Egypt", was spared destruction due to being in Connecticut for repair. The third Notre Dame was designed and built around this window. The three Angels that had adorned the Sanctuary Lamp and two candlesticks, though in the middle of the blaze, managed to survive the inferno. These too are part of the new church. The Sacred Heart Monument also miraculously survived the blaze even though it was in close proximity to the church. It wasn't until 1986 that the new church was built and ready for use. The orientation of the new building is reverse what the old one was. The new churches "front" sits in the footprint of the old churches "rear". In 2012, it was revealed that the parish of Notre Dame de Lourdes would be merging with the parish of Immaculate Conception in Fall River. This occurred in June 2012 and they will be using Notre Dame as their church, taking on the name St. Bernadette.

claim: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child”
question_en: Is sperm donation safe?
report_en: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child” [1]. To reduce genetic risks such as accidental consanguinity, many jurisdictions cap the number of families or children a single donor can father [1]. While these rules help safeguard recipients, enforcement gaps exist because a bank may ship sperm abroad and donors can give samples at multiple clinics, potentially bypassing local limits [1]. Therefore, the practical level of safety hinges on choosing a reputable, regulated bank that complies with disease testing, genetic screening, and traceability standards, and on confirming that the donor has not exceeded recommended offspring limits.

Cependant, une telle législation ne peut généralement pas empêcher une banque de spermatozoïdes de fournir des spermatozoïdes en dehors de la juridiction dans laquelle il fonctionne, et il ne peut pas non plus empêcher les donneurs de sperme de faire un don ailleurs au cours de leur vie. Il y a une pénurie aiguë de donneurs de spermatozoïdes dans de nombreuses régions du monde et il y a une pression évidente de nombreux quartiers pour les spermatozoïdes des donneurs de ceux qui souhaitent et capables de le fournir à disposer aussi en toute sécurité et aussi librement que possible.

Content: In Israel, sperm donation is mandated by the Ministry of Health. There are 12 authorized sperm banks and hospitals across the country, and 2 more in private research facilities. Only unmarried, healthy men under the age of 30 are allowed to donate sperm, and they are financially compensated for it. Men who want to donate must get to the hospital, pass an interview and blood-checks. They are also prohibited from donating sperm in more than one sperm bank. Finally, anonymity is kept indefinitely; the donor would never receive information regarding offsprings, and vice versa.

question_en: Is sperm donation safe?
report_en: Sperm donation is generally considered safe when carried out through licensed sperm banks that follow stringent screening and storage protocols; these facilities are “often controlled by local legislation which is primarily intended to protect the unborn child” [1]. To reduce genetic risks such as accidental consanguinity, many jurisdictions cap the number of families or children a single donor can father [1]. While these rules help safeguard recipients, enforcement gaps exist because a bank may ship sperm abroad and donors can give samples at multiple clinics, potentially bypassing local limits [1]. Therefore, the practical level of safety hinges on choosing a reputable, regulated bank that complies with disease testing, genetic screening, and traceability standards, and on confirming that the donor has not exceeded recommended offspring limits.

Title: Sperm donation laws by country
Content: In Israel, sperm donation is mandated by the Ministry of Health. There are 12 authorized sperm banks and hospitals across the country, and 2 more in private research facilities. Only unmarried, healthy men under the age of 30 are allowed to donate sperm, and they are financially compensated for it. Men who want to donate must get to the hospital, pass an interview and blood-checks. They are also prohibited from donating sperm in more than one sperm bank. Finally, anonymity is kept indefinitely; the donor would never receive information regarding offsprings, and vice versa.

Title: Donghak Peasant Revolution
Content: In October 22, 2,000 rebels were killed in the consequent Battle of Jajak Pass, the largest battle in Gangwon Province before the Korean War. The rebels lacked guns, and they used birch branches as weapons. They also lacked pots, and cooked rice over cattle hide. Because of the narrowness of the pass, the rebels were crowded, and it was easy for Maeng's troops to fire into the camp and kill rebels. Maeng himself reports that "it was impossible to see how many died", but descendants have given an estimate of 1,800~2,000. Descendants also report that the battle continued for three or four days. The Seonang Pass was renamed Jajak Pass, because the blood made a 'Jajak' sound as it rolled down the pass.

Title: Gona Barracks
Content: The former Gona Barracks is important in demonstrating the pattern of Queensland's history as evidence of Queensland's preparations for military involvement in various world conflicts. Specifically, Gona Barracks is associated with the expansion of military training for militia forces after the introduction of compulsory military training in 1911, the provision of facilities for specialist militia units, and the continuation of voluntary military forces until 1998. The place contains World War I drill halls built for militia units of infantry, and more specialised groups such as the artillery, engineers and service corps, and as such demonstrates the extent of the various sections of the armed forces at the time and the commitment of the citizen soldiers who composed these units. The general size of the barracks site also demonstrates the site's early history as the Brisbane Grammar School endowment, from 1879 to 1911.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Tylenol (marque)
Content: La marque a été introduite en 1955 par McNeil Laboratories, un fabricant pharmaceutique familial. Deux frères ont repris l'entreprise de leur père cette année-là, et cette année-là, l'un d'eux a appris le paracétamol, qui n'était pas sur le marché américain à l'époque. Pour éviter de concurrencer l'aspirine, ils l'ont commercialisé en tant que produit pour réduire la fièvre chez les enfants, l'emballant comme un camion de pompiers rouge avec le slogan, "pour Little Hotheads". Le nom "Tylenol" et le nom générique "acétaminophène" ont été générés par McNeil à partir du nom chimique du médicament. Johnson & Johnson a acheté McNeil en 1959, et un an plus tard, le médicament a été mis à disposition en vente libre.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Burson-Marsteller
Content: At a Burson-Marsteller organized press conference in November 1982, Johnson & Johnson introduced new tamper-proof packaging, becoming the first company to introduce triple-sealed packaging, which later became the industry standard. The conference gave Johnson & Johnson the opportunity to announce that they were reintroducing Tylenol capsules to the market and would replace any Tylenol that consumers had thrown away. In addition, Johnson & Johnson published advertisements with coupons for consumers to use in replacing Tylenol that had been thrown out and produced commercials and print advertisements thanking the public for their "continuing confidence and support". Within six weeks of the introduction of the repackaged product Tylenol's sales returned to the previous level. In 1983, Burson-Marsteller was awarded a Silver Anvil for "out-of-the-ordinary crisis management" for its work with Johnson & Johnson. The company was brought back to handle crisis management during a second Tylenol crisis, involving cyanide tainting in New York in 1986.

Title: Chiffre numérique
Content: De l'Inde, le commerce florissant entre les sultans islamiques et l'Afrique a transporté le concept au Caire. Les mathématiciens arabes ont étendu le système pour inclure des fractions décimales, et Muḥammad Ibn Mūsā al-ḵwārizmī a écrit une œuvre importante à ce sujet au 9ème siècle. Les chiffres arabes modernes ont été introduits en Europe avec la traduction de cette œuvre au XIIe siècle en Espagne et Leonardo de "Liber Abaci" de Pise de 1201. En Europe, le système indien complet avec le zéro a été dérivé des Arabes du XIIe siècle.

Document ID: 2
Title: Arabic numerals
Content: The Hindu-Arabic numeral system was developed by Indian mathematicians around AD 500 using quite different forms of the numerals. From India, the system was adopted by Arabic mathematicians in Baghdad and passed on to the Arabs farther west. The current form of the numerals developed in North Africa. It was in the North African city of Bejaia that the Italian scholar Fibonacci first encountered the numerals; his work was crucial in making them known throughout Europe. The use of Arabic numerals spread around the world through European trade, books and colonialism.

Document ID: 2
Title: Warren B. Hamilton
Content: Hamilton led a two-man field party in Antarctica (October 1958–January 1959) for the International Geophysical Year, and launched a new understanding of Antarctica. He was the first to apply the name trans-Antarctic Mountains (two years later, formalized as Transantarctic Mountains) to that 3,500 km range. Hamilton recognized that a large sector of this range contained distinctive granitic rocks like South Australia's Adelaide orogenic belt. Associated fossils of diverse ages in Antarctica, Australia, and southernmost Africa further linked these continents, and supported then-radical explanations of continental drift. Before traveling to Antarctica, Hamilton was what he later described as a "closet drifter," aware that Southern Hemisphere geology provided powerful evidence favoring continental drift. He returned to Antarctica for fieldwork in 1963 and 1964 in other parts of the Transantarctic Mountains, including those once continuous with other Australian tracts. He also investigated in the field evidence for drift in Australia and South Africa, integrating his work with that of other researchers to show how Antarctica and other Gondwana continents had drifted apart.

Title: The Cat in the Hat
Content: According to Judith and Neil Morgan, the book sold well immediately. The trade edition initially sold an average of 12,000 copies a month, a figure which rose rapidly. However, Houghton Mifflin's school edition did not sell as well. As Geisel noted in Jonathan Cott's 1983 profile of him, "Houghton Mifflin... had trouble selling it to the schools; there were a lot of Dick and Jane devotees, and my book was considered too fresh and irreverent. But Bennett Cerf at Random House had asked for trade rights, and it just took off in the bookstores." Geisel told the Morgans, "Parents understood better than school people the necessity for this kind of reader."

claim: Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion
question_en: Does cognitive dissonance factor into pluralistic ignorance?
report_en: Yes; research indicates that cognitive dissonance can play a role in pluralistic ignorance, but its influence varies by context. Prentice and Miller observed that male students who privately felt less comfortable with campus drinking shifted their attitudes toward what they erroneously believed was the campus norm, exemplifying a dissonance‐driven realignment of private beliefs with perceived public opinion [1]. Female students, however, did not show this attitude change, indicating that dissonance pressure was weaker where drinking norms were less central to identity [1]. Moreover, subsequent work on non-drinkers such as vegetarians shows that pluralistic ignorance can also emerge from the topology of social networks without invoking cognitive dissonance, demonstrating that dissonance is a common but not universal mechanism behind the phenomenon [1].
all_claims: Yes; research indicates that cognitive dissonance can play a role in pluralistic ignorance, but its influence varies by context.

Moreover, subsequent work on non-drinkers such as vegetarians shows that pluralistic ignorance can also emerge from the topology of social networks without invoking cognitive dissonance, demonstrating that dissonance is a common but not universal mechanism behind the phenomenon [1].

Title: Ignorance pluraliste
Content: Prentice et Miller ont constaté qu'en moyenne, les niveaux de confort privés avec les pratiques de consommation d'alcool sur le campus étaient bien inférieurs à la moyenne perçue. Dans le cas des hommes, ils ont trouvé un changement d'attitudes privées envers cette norme perçue, une forme de dissonance cognitive. Les femmes, en revanche, se sont avérées avoir un sentiment d'aliénation accru sur le campus, mais manquaient de changement d'attitude détecté chez les hommes, probablement parce que les normes liées à la consommation d'alcool sur le campus sont beaucoup plus centrales pour les hommes que pour les femmes. La recherche a montré que l'ignorance pluraliste des fléaux non seulement ceux qui se livrent, mais aussi ceux qui s'abstiennent: du jeu, du tabagisme et de la consommation d'alcool et parmi certains qui suivent le végétarisme. Ce dernier a constaté que l'ignorance pluraliste peut être causée par la structure du réseau social sous-jacent, et non sur la dissonance cognitive.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Interpersonal communication
Content: When individuals encounter new information or new experiences, they categorize the information based on their preexisting attitudes, thoughts, and beliefs. If the new encounter does not coincide with their preexisting assumptions, then dissonance is likely to occur. When dissonance does occur, individuals are motivated to reduce the dissonance they experience by avoiding situations that would either cause the dissonance or increase the dissonance. For this reason, cognitive dissonance is considered a drive state that encourages motivation to achieve consonance and reduce dissonance.
An example of cognitive dissonance would be if someone holds the belief that maintaining a healthy lifestyle is important, but they don't regularly work out or eat healthy. They may experience dissonance between their beliefs and their actions. If there is a significant amount of dissonance, they may be motivated to change their attitudes and work out more or eat healthier foods. They may also be inclined to avoid situations that will point out the fact that their attitudes and beliefs are inconsistent, such as avoiding the gym or not reading health reports.According to cognitive dissonance theory, there are three types of cognitive relationships: consonant relationships, dissonant relationships, and irrelevant relationships. Consonant relationships are when two elements, such as your beliefs and actions, are in equilibrium with each other or coincide. Dissonant relationships are when two elements are not in equilibrium and cause dissonance. Irrelevant relationships are when two elements do not possess a meaningful relationship with one another, they are unrelated and do not cause dissonance.
---

She was also responsible for the Who Killed Tom King? storyline, which was nominated for Best Storyline at the 2007 British Soap Awards. Title: Wilt Chamberlain
Content: Wilton Norman Chamberlain (; 21 août 1936 - 12 octobre 1999) était un basketteur américain qui a joué au centre et est considéré comme l'un des joueurs les plus importants et les plus dominants de l'histoire de la NBA. Il a joué pour les Warriors de Philadelphie / San Francisco, les Philadelphia 76ers et les Los Angeles Lakers de la National Basketball Association (NBA). Il a joué pour l'Université du Kansas et aussi pour les Harlem Globetrotters avant de jouer dans la NBA. Chamberlain se tenait debout et pesait comme une recrue avant de gonfler jusqu'à 275 et finalement avec les Lakers.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Wilt Chamberlain
Content: Wilton Norman Chamberlain was born in Philadelphia, into a family of nine children, the son of Olivia Ruth Johnson, a domestic worker and homemaker, and William Chamberlain, a welder, custodian, and handyman. He was a frail child, nearly dying of pneumonia in his early years and missing a whole year of school as a result. In his early years Chamberlain was not interested in basketball, because he thought it was "a game for sissies". Instead, he was an avid track and field athlete: as a youth, he high jumped 6 feet, 6 inches, ran the 440 yards in 49.0 seconds and the 880 yards in 1:58.3, put the shot 53 feet, 4 inches, and broad jumped 22 feet. But according to Chamberlain, "basketball was king in Philadelphia", so he eventually turned to the sport. Because Chamberlain was a very tall child, already measuring at age 10 and when he entered Philadelphia's Overbrook High School, he had a natural advantage against his peers; he soon was renowned for his scoring talent, his physical strength and his shot blocking abilities. According to ESPN journalist Hal Bock, Chamberlain was "scary, flat-out frightening... before he came along, most basketball players were mortal-sized men. Chamberlain changed that." It was also in this period of his life when his three lifelong nicknames "Wilt the Stilt", "Goliath", and his favorite, "The Big Dipper", were allegedly born.
---

Title: Georgios Papadopoulos

Il était le fils aîné et avait deux frères, Konstantinos et Haralambos. Après avoir terminé ses études secondaires en 1937, il s'est inscrit à la Hellenic Military Academy, terminant son programme de trois ans en 1940.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Georgios Papadopoulos
Content: Translated as:
A failed assassination attempt against Papadopoulos was perpetrated by Alexandros Panagoulis in the morning of 13 August 1968, when Papadopoulos was driven from his summer residence in Lagonisi to Athens, escorted by his personal security motorcycles and cars. Panagoulis ignited a bomb at a point of the coastal road where the limousine carrying Papadopoulos would have to slow down, but the bomb failed to harm Papadopoulos. Panagoulis was captured a few hours later in a nearby sea cave, since the boat sent to help him escape was instructed to leave at a specific time and he couldn't swim there on time due to strong sea currents. After his arrest, he was taken to the Greek Military Police (EAT-ESA) offices where he was questioned, beaten and tortured. On 17 November 1968, Panagoulis was sentenced to death but was personally pardoned by Papadopoulos, served only five years in prison, and after democracy was restored was elected a member of Parliament. He was regarded as an emblematic figure of the struggle to restore democracy, and as such has often been paralleled to Harmodius and Aristogeiton, two ancient Athenians known for their assassination tyrannicide of Hipparchus.

Title: Acide 5-hydroxyeicosatetraenoïque
Content: Le lauréat du prix Nobel, Bengt I. Samuelssson, et ses collègues ont décrit pour la première fois 5 ("S") - Hete en 1976 comme un métabolite d'acide arachidonique fabriqué par des neutrophiles de lapin. L'activité biologique lui a été liée plusieurs années plus tard, lorsqu'elle s'est avérée stimuler les neutrophiles humains, les augmentations du calcium cytosolique, la chimiotaxie et l'augmentation de leur adhésivité de la surface cellulaire comme indiqué par leur agrégation les uns aux autres. Depuis un métabolite d'acide arachidonique découvert précédemment fabriqué par des neutrophiles, leukotriène B4 (LTB), stimule également les augmentations de calcium des neutrophiles humains, la chimiotaxie et l'agggrégation automatique et est structurellement similaire à 5 ("S") - hete en étant 5 - ("S") - hydroxy-eicosateraenoate 5 - ("S") - HÉTER a stimulé les cellules à travers les mêmes récepteurs de surface cellulaire que ceux utilisés par (LTB), à savoir les récepteurs Leucotriène B4. Cependant, d'autres études sur les neutrophiles ont indiqué que 5 - ("S") - HÉTER agit à travers un récepteur distinct de celui utilisé par les LTB ainsi que divers autres stimuli de neutrophiles. Ce récepteur 5 ("S") - HÉTER est appelé le récepteur 1 oxoéicosanoïde 1 (abrégé AS (Oxer1).

Title: Sénat du Kazakhstan
Content: Le Sénat du Kazakhastan ("Qazaqstan Parlameniniń Senaty") est la chambre haute de deux chambres à la législature du Kazakhstan, connue sous le nom de Parlement ("Parlameti"). Le Sénat est composé de membres élus - deux de chaque région, la ville d'importance républicaine (Almaty) et la capitale de la République du Kazakhstan lors des séances conjointes des membres de tous les organes représentatifs des régions respectives, de la ville de l'importance républicaine et de la capitale de la République.
Les membres du Sénat sont élus sur la base du suffrage indirect par un scrutin secret. La moitié des membres élus du Sénat sont présentés aux élections tous les trois ans.
Quinze membres sont nommés par le président du Kazakhstan en vue d'assurer la représentation de toutes les diverses composantes nationales et culturelles de la société.
Le mandat des membres du Sénat est de 6 ans.
Selon les normes constitutionnelles au Parlement de la cinquième convocation, les membres du Sénat élus en 2011 et 2014 et ceux nommés par le président de la République du Kazakhstan en 2011 et 2013 continuent de tenir fonction.

Title: Théorie de l'activité (vieillissement)
Content: La théorie de l'activité, également connue sous le nom de théorie implicite du vieillissement, la théorie normale du vieillissement et la théorie laïque du vieillissement, propose que le vieillissement réussi se produit lorsque les personnes âgées restent actives et maintiennent les interactions sociales. Il convient que le processus de vieillissement est retardé et que la qualité de vie est améliorée lorsque les personnes âgées restent socialement actives. 
La théorie de l'activité a augmenté dans la réponse opposée à la théorie du désengagement. La théorie de l'activité et la théorie du désengagement étaient les deux théories majeures qui ont décrit le vieillissement réussi au début des années 1960. La théorie a été développée par Robert J. Havighurst en 1961. En 1964, Bernice Neugarten a affirmé que la satisfaction dans la vieillesse dépendait du maintien actif des relations personnelles et des efforts.

Title: Activity theory
Content: AT remained virtually unknown outside the Soviet Union until the mid-1980s, when it was picked up by Scandinavian researchers. The first international conference on activity theory was not held until 1986. The earliest non-Soviet paper cited by Nardi is a 1987 paper by Yrjö Engeström: "Learning by expanding". This resulted in a reformulation of AT. Kuutti notes that the term "activity theory" "can be used in two senses: referring to the original Soviet tradition or referring to the international, multi-voiced community applying the original ideas and developing them further."

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Pearl Brewing Company
Content: En 1952, lorsque la San Antonio Brewing Association a changé son nom pour la Pearl Brewing Company, le Triple XS a rejoint le nom de Pearl en tant qu'image dominante sur le produit et la société dans son ensemble. Les Triple XS étaient de retour sur le logo de l'entreprise et ont été utilisés sur presque toutes les publicités de Pearl. Le XS a occupé ce rôle important jusqu'à la fin de la production à la brasserie en 2001, lorsque la brasserie a fermé ses portes et que le logo de l'entreprise a été abandonné. Alors que la production de Pearl et Pearl Light se retournait à l'installation de Miller Fort Worth, les logos de produits ont été repensés. L'étiquette mise à jour n'utilise pas le Triple XS, donc une partie importante de l'identité de l'entreprise a été pratiquement éliminée des bières perlées. Cependant, la liqueur de malt country club de Pearl affiche toujours les xxx dans son logo.
Beaucoup de gens se demandent d'où viennent les X et comment ont-ils été utilisés sur la bière. En vérité, les trois X sont en fait un système de notation de qualité. Le système a été initialement utilisé en Europe au 16ème siècle. Alors que la royauté européenne parcourait leurs terres et visitait les comtés voisins, un courrier royal a été envoyé avant le parti officiel. Le travail du courrier était de goûter à la bière dans les auberges en cours de route. Si la bière n'était que moyenne, le courrier marquerait le panneau ou la porte de l'auberge avec un seul X. Si la bière de l'auberge était jugée bonne, le panneau ou la porte recevrait deux X. Une marque sur une auberge de trois X a signifié que la bière à l'intérieur était excellente, et un incontournable pour la cour royale lorsqu'ils passaient.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Pearl Brewing Company
Content: The triple Xs were adopted by the San Antonio Brewing Association to portray two things: the high quality of their beers, and the pride that workers put into their products. The triple Xs may be gone from company and Pearl beer logos, but it has not completely vanished. In the 1960s, Pearl absorbed the Goetz Brewing Company and made Country Club Malt Liquor one of Pearl's key products. When Country Club received its only product makeover a few years after the buyout, it gained the triple Xs in its logo. The Xs were situated in the top-center of the logo's crown. Country Club is still produced today, and it still carries the “xXx” mark of Pearl.

claim: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion
question_en: Can you cut a nerve fiber?
report_en: Yes, a nerve fiber (axon) can be cut, either traumatically or intentionally during surgery, resulting in loss of motor or sensory function distal to the lesion [1]. When this occurs, surgeons may attempt microsurgical repair or use autologous nerve grafts, which redirect regenerating donor axons through a graft conduit to re-establish connection with target muscles or skin [1]. Functional recovery after such repair is highly age-dependent: young children often regain near-normal nerve function, whereas patients over 60 years old typically recover only protective sensation, such as the ability to distinguish hot from cold or sharp from dull [1]. Adjunctive strategies like localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors are under investigation to accelerate axonal regeneration within grafts [1].

Title: Lésion nerveuse
Content: La chirurgie peut être effectuée au cas où un nerf serait coupé ou autrement divisé. La récupération d'un nerf après réparation chirurgicale dépend principalement de l'âge du patient. Les jeunes enfants peuvent récupérer la fonction nerveuse proches des normaux. En revanche, un patient de plus de 60 ans avec un nerf coupé dans la main s'attendrait à récupérer uniquement la sensation de protection, c'est-à-dire la capacité de distinguer chaud / froid ou net / terne. De nombreux autres facteurs affectent également la récupération nerveuse. L'utilisation de procédures de greffage nerveuse autologues qui impliquent la redirection des fibres nerveuses du donneur régénératif dans le conduit de greffe a réussi à restaurer la fonction musculaire cible. La livraison localisée de facteurs neurotrophiques solubles peut aider à favoriser le taux de régénération des axones observé dans ces conduits de greffe.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Neurolytic block
Content: A neurolytic block is a form of nerve block involving the deliberate injury of a nerve by freezing or heating ("neurotomy") or the application of chemicals ("neurolysis"). These interventions cause degeneration of the nerve's fibers and temporary (a few months, usually) interference with the transmission of nerve signals. In these procedures, the thin protective layer around the nerve fiber, the basal lamina, is preserved so that, as a damaged fiber regrows, it travels within its basal lamina tube and connects with the correct loose end, and function may be restored. Surgical cutting of a nerve (neurectomy), severs these basal lamina tubes, and without them to channel the regrowing fibers to their lost connections, over time a painful neuroma or deafferentation pain may develop. This is why the neurolytic is usually preferred over the surgical block.
---

Title: Neurolytic block
Content: A neurolytic block is a form of nerve block involving the deliberate injury of a nerve by freezing or heating ("neurotomy") or the application of chemicals ("neurolysis"). These interventions cause degeneration of the nerve's fibers and temporary (a few months, usually) interference with the transmission of nerve signals. In these procedures, the thin protective layer around the nerve fiber, the basal lamina, is preserved so that, as a damaged fiber regrows, it travels within its basal lamina tube and connects with the correct loose end, and function may be restored. Surgical cutting of a nerve (neurectomy), severs these basal lamina tubes, and without them to channel the regrowing fibers to their lost connections, over time a painful neuroma or deafferentation pain may develop. This is why the neurolytic is usually preferred over the surgical block.
---

Selon Joran Friberg, un historien des mathématiques, les preuves indiquent que le théorème pythagorien "était bien connu des mathématiciens de la vieille période babylonienne" (20e au XVIe siècle avant JC), qui aurait eu plus de mille ans avant la naissance de Pythagore. Pythagorean triples occur when all three sides of a right triangle are integers such as a = 3, b = 4 and c = 5. A clay tablet shows that the Babylonians knew of Pythagorean triples 1200 years before Pythagoras, but nobody knows if they knew the more-general Pythagorean theorem. The Chinese proof uses four similar triangles to prove the theorem.

Lorsque Jacobs telard a été vendu à Kraft General Foods en 1990, Brach a été maintenu séparé par le propriétaire Klaus J. Jacobs. Title: Dentiers
Content: La fabrication d'un ensemble de prothèses complètes est un défi pour tout dentiste / dentiste. Il existe de nombreux axiomes dans la production de prothèses dentaires qui doivent être comprises; L'ignorance d'un axiome peut entraîner une défaillance de la prothèse. Dans la grande majorité des cas, les prothèses complètes devraient être confortables peu de temps après l'insertion, bien que presque toujours au moins deux visites d'ajustement soient nécessaires pour éliminer la cause des taches douloureuses. L'un des aspects les plus critiques des prothèses dentaires est que l'impression de la prothèse doit être parfaitement fabriquée et utilisée avec une technique parfaite pour créer un modèle précis des gencives édentées (édentées) édentées du patient. Le dentiste ou le dentiste doit utiliser un processus appelé moulage de bordure pour s'assurer que les brides de prothèse sont correctement étendues. Un éventail de problèmes peut survenir si l'empreinte finale de la prothèse n'est pas correctement faite. Il faut une patience et une expérience considérables pour qu'un dentiste sache comment faire une prothèse, et pour cette raison, il peut être dans le meilleur intérêt du patient de rechercher un spécialiste, un prothodontiste ou de dentiste, de faire la prothèse. Un dentiste est un professionnel formé et agréé qui voit les patients qui ont besoin de prothèses dentaires, de partiels, de lines ou de réparations. Un dentiste ne prend pas seulement l'impression, mais fait toute la prothèse dans son propre laboratoire. Le dentiste prévoit ensuite une date pour la livraison des prothèses dentaires finies au patient. Un dentiste général peut faire du bon travail à faire des prothèses dentaires, mais seulement s'il est méticuleux et expérimenté. De nombreux dentistes ne font plus de prothèses elles-mêmes. Mais plutôt prenez une impression de la bouche des patients, puis envoyez les impressions à un laboratoire dentaire, qui pourrait être n'importe où dans le monde, soit envoyer le patient à un dentiste. Une fois que le laboratoire reçoit des impressions dentaires de la bouche du patient, le laboratoire en crée des moules en plâtre. Le laboratoire utilise les moules pour créer les jantes en cire utilisées pour enregistrer la morsure du patient. Ces jantes en cire sont retournées au dentiste, qui Les utilise pour enregistrer la morsure du patient. Le dentiste peut aider le patient à choisir la bonne taille des dents pour les prothèses dentaires, ou simplement faire la sélection lui-même. Une fois l'enregistrement des morsures terminé et les dents sélectionnées pour les prothèses dentaires, la jante de cire est généralement retournée au laboratoire dentaire afin que les dents dentaires soient placées dans la cire. Une fois que les dents sont installées dans le bord de cire, le résultat est une prothèse préfini qui ressemble presque au produit fini. Cette prothèse préfini est généralement retournée au bureau du dentiste et le patient a généralement une chance d'approuver la configuration (pour les prothèses dentaires immédiates ou standard) ou d'essayer la prothèse avant sa fin. Après l'approbation du patient, le dentiste renvoie la pré-prête au laboratoire pour le traitement final. La prothèse finie est ensuite retournée au bureau du dentiste pour livraison au patient.

Title: Denture cleaner
Content: A denture cleaner (also termed denture cleanser), is a cleaner used to clean dentures when they are out of the mouth. Their main use is to control the growth of microorganisms on the dentures, especially "Candida albicans", thereby preventing denture-related stomatitis. When dentures are worn in the mouth, a biofilm develops which may be similar to dental plaque. It may become hardened and mineralized as dental calculus. Denture cleansers are also used to remove stains and other debris that may be caused by diet, tobacco use, drinking coffee, drinking tea, etc.

Title: Sociobiologie
Content: Par exemple, les lions masculins nouvellement dominants tuent souvent des oursons dans la fierté qu'ils ne sont pas en train de sombrer. Ce comportement est adaptatif parce que tuer les Cubs élimine la concurrence pour leur propre progéniture et provoque la chaleur aux femmes en soins infirmiers, permettant ainsi à plus de ses gènes d'entrer dans la population. Les sociobiologistes considéreraient ce comportement instinctif de tueurs de petits comme étant héritée par les gènes de la reproduction avec succès des lions mâles, tandis que le comportement non killing peut s'être éteint car ces lions ont moins réussi à reproduire.

Title: Lion
Content: When first introduced to the rest of the pride, lion cubs lack confidence when confronted with adults other than their mother. They soon begin to immerse themselves in the pride life, however, playing among themselves or attempting to initiate play with the adults. Lionesses with cubs of their own are more likely to be tolerant of another lioness's cubs than lionesses without cubs. Male tolerance of the cubs varies – sometimes a male will patiently let the cubs play with his tail or his mane, whereas another may snarl and bat the cubs away.
Weaning occurs after six or seven months. Male lions reach maturity at about three years of age and at four to five years are capable of challenging and displacing adult males associated with another pride. They begin to age and weaken at between 10 and 15 years of age at the latest. When one or more new males oust the previous males associated with a pride, the victors often kill any existing young cubs, perhaps because females do not become fertile and receptive until their cubs mature or die. Females often fiercely defend their cubs from a usurping male but are rarely successful unless a group of three or four mothers within a pride join forces against the male. Cubs also die from starvation and abandonment, and predation by leopards, hyenas and wild dogs. Up to 80% of lion cubs will die before the age of two.
---

question_en: What does nerfing mean?
report_en: In video-game design, “nerfing” refers to deliberately reducing the power, desirability, or overall effectiveness of a specific game element—such as a weapon, ability, or character—in order to improve balance and fairness; the term functions both as a noun (“a nerf”) and a verb (“to nerf”) [1]. The expression originated among players of the 1997 MMORPG Ultima Online, where frustrated users likened weakened virtual weapons to foam Nerf-brand toys whose soft projectiles are unlikely to cause serious harm, highlighting how the adjustment makes an element less threatening without removing it entirely [1].

Title: Nerf war
Content: A Nerf war is an activity involving Nerf Blasters or other foam-firing toy weapons. Nerf wars can be a wide range of games, from informal shootouts in offices and basements to well-organized outdoor battles with high-powered modified blasters. Since foam-firing guns are relatively safe and cheap, Nerf wars can include participants and battlefields otherwise unsuitable for airsoft and paintball.
Nerf wars can take place anywhere. Any area with a good balance of open space and cover can be a candidate. Basements, offices, and backyards are common locations for informal games. For larger wars with more participants, bigger venues like gymnasiums, public parks, forests, ravines, and schools make good playing areas. The inside of a large hall such as a room can may be turned into a battlefield by turning tables onto their sides. When planning a Nerf war in a public area, the organizer typically reserves the space and watches out for non-participants to reduce any liability. The ability to play in free locations is an important element of a Nerf war's accessibility.

Title: Jeu de jeux de jeux
Content: Game Show Network a été lancé à 19 h 00. ET le 1er décembre 1994. Le premier jeu de jeux diffusé était "What's My Line?". De 1994 à environ 1997, le réseau a diffusé des émissions de jeu pré-1972 classiques ainsi que des émissions de jeux réalisées après 1972, dont la plupart provenaient de la bibliothèque Mark Goodson - Bill Todman. Le réseau a diffusé des spectacles dans un cycle de 24 heures et a également utilisé des interstitiels en direct comme programmation enveloppante. Au cours de ses premiers mois, les publicités de GSN se composaient d'annonces de services publics (PSA), des promotions pour sa programmation et des publicités liées à la société mère du réseau Sony. En 1995, lorsque le réseau a commencé à se développer, le réseau a commencé à accepter la publicité conventionnelle alors qu'elle gagnait de nouveaux parrainages. Le 17 mars 1997, le réseau de jeux de jeux a renommé un nouveau package de présentation et un nouveau logo (qui avait le nom du réseau dans les boîtes et une balle tourbillonnante colorée) et un nouveau slogan "All Play, All Day". Alors que le logo a changé, sa programmation est restée inchangée, le réseau a également fait ses débuts de nouvelles promotions et de nouveaux idents ce jour-là, conçu par l'agence graphique Lee Hunt Associates.

Title: Game Show Network
Content: On April 18, 1998, Game Show Network bought back the rights to the Goodson-Todman library. In late 1998, GSN eliminated all of its live programming, replacing them with in-show advertisements like "Win TV". In 1999, the network began a slate of original programming, including "Inquizition", "All New 3's a Crowd", and "Hollywood Showdown". The channel also launched original shows such as "Extreme Gong" (a remake of the classic "Gong Show"). In 2000, the network faced another setback when GSN lost the rights to broadcast "The Price Is Right", with the last episode airing on April 3 of that year.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Médicaments spécialisés aux États-Unis
Content: Les médicaments spécialisés ou les produits pharmaceutiques spécialisés sont une désignation récente de produits pharmaceutiques qui sont classés comme un coût élevé, élevé et / ou un toucher élevé. Les médicaments spécialisés sont souvent des biologiques - "des médicaments dérivés de cellules vivantes" qui sont injectables ou infusés (bien que certains soient des médicaments oraux). Ils sont utilisés pour traiter des affections chroniques complexes ou rares telles que le cancer, la polyarthrite rhumatoïde, l'hémophilie, H.I.V. Le psoriasis, les maladies inflammatoires de l'intestin et l'hépatite C. En 1990, il y avait 10 médicaments spécialisés sur le marché, au milieu des années 1990, il y avait moins de 30, d'ici 2008, il y en avait 200 et en 2015, il y avait 300. Les médicaments sont souvent définis comme spécialisés car leur prix est beaucoup plus élevé que celui des médicaments non spécialisés. Medicare définit tout médicament pour lequel le prix négocié est de 670 $ par mois ou plus, en tant que médicament spécialisé qui est placé dans un niveau de spécialité qui nécessite un partage de coûts des patients plus élevé. Les médicaments sont également identifiés comme spécialisés lorsqu'il existe une exigence de gestion spéciale ou que le médicament n'est disponible que via un réseau de distribution limité. En 2015, "les médicaments spécialisés ont représenté un tiers de toutes les dépenses en médicaments aux États-Unis, contre 19% en 2004 et se dirigeant vers 50% au cours des 10 prochaines années", selon IMS Health, qui suit les prescriptions. Selon un article de 2010 dans Forbes, les médicaments spécialisés pour les maladies rares sont devenus plus chers "que quiconque ne l'imaginait" et leur succès est venu "à un moment où l'entreprise traditionnelle de médicaments de vente de médicaments aux masses" était "en déclin". En 2015, l'analyse par "The Wall Street Journal" a suggéré que la grande prime était due à la valeur perçue des traitements de maladies rares qui sont généralement très coûteux par rapport aux traitements pour des maladies plus courantes.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Specialty drugs in the United States
Content: On September 27, 2007 President George W. Bush amended the Food and Drug Administration Amendments Act of 2007 (FDAAA) to authorize the FDA to require Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies (REMS) on medications if necessary to minimize the risks associated with some drugs". These medications were designated as specialty drugs and required specialty pharmacies. When the FDA approves a new drug they may require a REMS program which "may contain any combination of 5 criteria: Medication Guide, Communication Plan, Elements to Assure Safe Use, Implementation System, and Timetable for Submission of Assessments". "In 2010, 48% of all new molecular entities, and 60% of all new specialty drug approvals, required a REMS program." Risk-reduction mechanisms can include the "use of specialized distribution partners", special pharmacy.
---

Title: Histoire de la région d'Otago
Content: La date précise à laquelle les premiers habitants de la Nouvelle-Zélande ont atteint Otago et l'extrême sud (connu de la maorie plus tard comme "Murihiku") reste incertain. Les maoris descendent d'une race de largeurs de mer polynésiens qui ont déménagé d'Asie de l'Est et d'Asie du Sud-Est aux îles du Pacifique. La tradition raconte leurs autres voyages de Hawaiki à la Nouvelle-Zélande, et certains commentateurs ont identifié cette patrie comme Havai'i, une île du groupe de la société. La surpopulation, la rareté de la nourriture et de la guerre civile ont forcé beaucoup d'entre elles à migrer une fois de plus, et la Nouvelle-Zélande est devenue leur nouvelle maison. Māori a installé la Nouvelle-Zélande entre la AD 1280-1320. Ils ont rapidement appris à chasser les nombreuses espèces de MOA et de phoques en Nouvelle-Zélande et se sont installées à travers les îles du Nord et du Sud en moins de quelques décennies. Il y a un changement dans le record du pollen d'Inland Otago il y a 600 ans, d'une forêt à une flore de front. Il a été déduit que cela concerne les incendies allumés lors de l'exploration maorie.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: History of New Zealand
Content: The history of New Zealand dates back at least 700 years to when it was discovered and settled by Polynesians, who developed a distinct Māori culture centred on kinship links and land. The first European explorer to sight New Zealand was Dutch navigator Abel Tasman on 13 December 1642. The Dutch were also the first non-natives to explore and chart New Zealand's coastline. Captain James Cook, who reached New Zealand in October 1769 on the first of his three voyages, was the first European explorer to circumnavigate and map New Zealand. From the late 18th century, the country was regularly visited by explorers and other sailors, missionaries, traders and adventurers. In 1840 the Treaty of Waitangi was signed between the British Crown and various Māori chiefs, bringing New Zealand into the British Empire and giving Māori the same rights as British subjects. There was extensive British settlement throughout the rest of the century and into the early part of the next century. War and the imposition of a European economic and legal system led to most of New Zealand's land passing from Māori to Pākehā (European) ownership, and most Māori subsequently became impoverished.
---

Parmi ses innovations sont les formations simples et doubles (précurseurs des formations modernes de propagation et de fusil de chasse), la position à trois points et la technique de blocage du corps. La chauve-souris est traditionnellement fabriquée à partir de bois de saule, en particulier à partir d'une variété de saules blancs appelés Willow de Cricket Bat ("Salix alba" var. Cette variété de saule est utilisée car elle est très dure et résistante aux chocs, n'étant pas considérablement bossé ni ne se sépare de l'impact d'une boule de cricket à grande vitesse, tout en étant léger. The umpires are also the arbiters of whether the pitch is fit for play, and if they deem it unfit, with the consent of both captains can change the pitch. Title: Northern Isles
Content: The Northern Isles (; ; ) are a pair of archipelagos off the north coast of mainland Scotland, comprising Orkney and Shetland. The climate is cool and temperate and much influenced by the surrounding seas. There are a total of 26 inhabited islands with landscapes of the fertile agricultural islands of Orkney contrasting with the more rugged Shetland islands to the north, where the economy is more dependent on fishing and the oil wealth of the surrounding seas. Both have a developing renewable energy industry. They also share a common Pictish and Norse history. Both island groups were absorbed into the Kingdom of Scotland in the 15th century and remained part of the country following the formation of the Kingdom of Great Britain in 1707, and later the United Kingdom after 1801. The islands played a significant naval role during the world wars of the 20th century.

Content: Les États-Unis ont développé le premier porte-avions, le «souvenir» de l'USS. Ce navire a navigué pour la première fois en 1920 et a aidé le gouvernement irlandais à supprimer une rébellion pro-britannique à Ulster. Le "souvenir", pendant de nombreuses années, a été le seul porte-avions américain. La guerre du Pacifique a vu les premières batailles navales où les combattants se sont engagés avec des avions au lieu de navires. Document ID: 2
Title: Kenneth Whiting
Content: Whiting sometimes is referred to as the U.S. Navys "father of the aircraft carrier." He had begun agitating for U.S. Navy development of what were then called "plane carriers" in the spring of 1916, and as early as March 1917 he had proposed to United States Secretary of the Navy Josephus Daniels that the Navy acquire a ship with an aircraft catapult and a flight deck, prompting the first serious U.S. Navy consideration of the acquisition of any kind of aviation ship since the American Civil War of 1861–1865. The United States Department of the Navy rejected his proposal on 20 June 1917. In the years between World War I and World War II, however, Whiting would be instrumental in the construction of five of the U.S. Navys first six aircraft carriers and serve as executive officer of its first two. He also served as acting commanding officer of its first carrier at a time when the United States was experimenting with many aspects of the operation of aircraft carriers and their aircraft.

claim: If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins
question_en: What happens when the president and VP of the USA die?
report_en: If a sitting President and Vice President die simultaneously, the Presidential Succession Act makes the Speaker of the House the next in line; if the Speaker is unwilling or constitutionally ineligible, succession passes to the President pro tempore of the Senate and then through Cabinet officers in a fixed order, each of whom must resign any congressional seat and meet the constitutional requirements for the presidency. If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1]. Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].
all_claims: If a sitting President and Vice President die simultaneously, the Presidential Succession Act makes the Speaker of the House the next in line; if the Speaker is unwilling or constitutionally ineligible, succession passes to the President pro tempore of the Senate and then through Cabinet officers in a fixed order, each of whom must resign any congressional seat and meet the constitutional requirements for the presidency.

If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1].

Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].
claims_retained: If the Vice President-elect dies before the Electoral College meets, the winning party’s national committee—after consulting the President-elect—selects a replacement for electors to support, ensuring a Vice President-elect is in place to be first in the line of succession once the new term begins [1].

Should such a vacancy arise after electors have voted, no substitute is chosen; instead, once inaugurated, the new President nominates a Vice President under the Twenty-fifth Amendment, subject to majority approval in both houses of Congress [1].

Title: Président élu des États-Unis
Content: Si le vice-président élu décède ou démissionne "avant" la réunion du Collège électoral en décembre, le Comité national du parti gagnant aurait, en consultation avec le président élu, un remplacement pour recevoir les votes électoraux du candidat vice-présidentiel de la même manière que cela se produirait si l'ancien candidat vice-présidentiel était devenu président-président en raison de la mort de l'appareil gagnant. En supposant le numéro requis, les électeurs ont accepté de voter pour le candidat de remplacement, cette personne deviendrait alors vice-présidente élue. Si une telle vacance devait se produire "après" que les votes électoraux avaient été exprimés aux États-Unis, la plupart des autorités soutiennent qu'aucun remplaçant ne serait choisi et que le nouveau président (après avoir pris ses fonctions) nommerait un vice-président, conformément aux dispositions du vingt-cinquième amendement à la Constitution.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: United States Constitution
Content: The Twenty-fifth Amendment (1967) clarifies what happens upon the death, removal, or resignation of the President or Vice President and how the Presidency is temporarily filled if the President becomes disabled and cannot fulfill the responsibilities of the office. It supersedes the ambiguous succession rule established in . A concrete plan of succession has been needed on multiple occasions since 1789. However, for nearly 20% of U.S. history, there has been no vice president in office who can assume the presidency.

Title: Second Boer War
Content: The number of horses killed in the war was at the time unprecedented in modern warfare. For example, in the Relief of Kimberley, French's cavalry rode 500 horses to their deaths in a single day. The average life expectancy of a British horse, from the time of its arrival in Port Elizabeth, was around six weeks.

claim: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation
question_en: Does Buddhism believe in Jesus?
report_en: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1]. While Christianity places monotheism and the crucifixion of Jesus, viewed as the once-for-all atonement for sin, at the center of faith, these concepts have no doctrinal counterpart in Buddhism, whose teachings focus instead on personal karma, the Four Noble Truths, and the Eightfold Path [1]. Individual Buddhists might respect Jesus as an ethical teacher, but traditional Buddhist scriptures neither mention him nor attribute salvific significance to his life or death.
all_claims: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1].

Individual Buddhists might respect Jesus as an ethical teacher, but traditional Buddhist scriptures neither mention him nor attribute salvific significance to his life or death.
claims_retained: Buddhism does not incorporate belief in Jesus as the divine Son of God or as a unique savior; its orientation is non-theistic, regarding the existence of a creator deity—and by extension Christian claims about Jesus—as largely irrelevant to the path of liberation [1].

Title: Shinji Takahashi (religious leader)
Content: Takahashi preached that Buddhism and Christianity in the present age have become academic, or formalized, and changed into a faith based on other powers. In response to this, he advocated returning to the times of Gotama Siddhartha and Jesus Christ in many of his literary works, starting with “"Ningen/Shaka"” (“Human Beings/Gotama Buddha”). In addition, Takahashi emphasized that neither Jesus Christ nor Gotama Siddhartha preached the thoughts of other powers at all, and that Christianity and Buddhism in their respective times were not complicated like the Christianity and Buddhism of today. With regard to the thoughts of other powers influencing these religions, these laws of nature (the pure religious base of Buddhism, Islam, and Christianity) transformed as a result of the intentions of those who were in power over time, as well as the interpretations of the many scholars; the cores of these laws of nature were lost, various theories became mixed, and they became academized in a complex manner and lost their substance. In addition, these laws of nature were intentionally distorted and conveyed to people for the purpose of individual's own benefit, and people were made to believe that those who obstructed this would be met with strict counteractions. This new set of distorted laws were slowly deemed as being the laws of nature as taught in today's versions of those religions.
---

Title: Langue espagnole
Content: L'Association des académies en langue espagnole (, OR) est l'entité qui réglemente la langue espagnole. Il a été créé au Mexique en 1951 et représente l'union de toutes les académies distinctes dans le monde hispanophone. It comprises the academies of 23 countries, ordered by date of Academy foundation: Spain (1713), Colombia (1871), Ecuador (1874), Mexico (1875), El Salvador (1876), Venezuela (1883), Chile (1885), Peru (1887), Guatemala (1887), Costa Rica (1923), Philippines (1924), Panama (1926), Cuba (1926),
Paraguay (1927), République dominicaine (1927), Bolivie (1927), Nicaragua (1928), Argentine (1931), Uruguay (1943), Honduras (1949), Puerto Rico (1955), États-Unis (1973) et équatoriale (2016).
Le (Cervantes Institute) est une organisation mondiale à but non lucratif créée par le gouvernement espagnol en 1991. Cette organisation s'est étendue dans plus de 20 pays différents, avec 54 centres dévoués aux cultures espagnoles et hispaniques américaines et la langue espagnole. Les objectifs ultimes de l'institut sont de promouvoir universellement l'éducation, l'étude et l'utilisation de l'espagnol comme deuxième langue, pour soutenir les méthodes et les activités qui aident le processus d'éducation en espagnol et pour contribuer à l'avancement des cultures espagnoles et hispaniques américaines dans les pays non épanouistes. Le rapport de 2015 de l'Institut "El Español, Una Lengua Viva" (espagnol, une langue vivante) estime qu'il y a 559 millions d'espagnols dans le monde. Parmi les sources citées dans le rapport figurent le US Census Bureau, qui estime que les États-Unis compteront 138 millions d'Espagnols d'ici 2050, ce qui en fait la plus grande nation espagnole sur Terre, avec l'espagnol la langue maternelle de près d'un tiers de ses citoyens.

In the Caribbean coast many afro-Nicaraguans and creoles speak English and creole English as their first language. Also in the Caribbean coast, many Indigenous people speak their native languages, such as the Miskito, Sumo, Rama and Garifuna language. In addition, many ethnic groups in Nicaragua, such as the Chinese Nicaraguans and Palestinian Nicaraguans, have maintained their ancestral languages, which are minority languages, while also speaking Spanish and/or English. Lin was the general who commanded the decisive Liaoshen and Pingjin Campaigns, in which he co-led the Manchurian Field Army to victory and led the People's Liberation Army into Beijing. He crossed the Yangtze River in 1949, decisively defeated the Kuomintang and took control of the coastal provinces in Southeast China. He ranked third among the Ten Marshals. Zhu De and Peng Dehuai were considered senior to Lin, and Lin ranked directly ahead of He Long and Liu Bocheng.

It is sometimes referred to as the world's largest owl, although Blakiston's fish owl ("B. blakistoni") is slightly heavier on average and the much lighter weight great grey owl ("Strix nebulosa") is slightly longer on average. Also, although shorter than the largest of the latter species, the Eurasian eagle-owl can weigh well more than twice as much as the largest great grey owl. In comparison, the barn owl ("Tyto alba"), the world's most widely distributed owl species, weighs about 500 g (1.1 lb) and the great horned owl ("Bubo virginianus"), which fills the eagle-owl's ecological niche in North America, weighs around 1.4 kg (3.1 lb).

Title: SS Great Eastern
Content: An early example of breaking-up a structure by use of a wrecking ball, she was scrapped at New Ferry on the River Mersey by Henry Bath & Son Ltd in 1889–1890 – it took 18 months to take her apart. At the time Everton Football Club were looking for a flagpole for their Anfield ground, and consequently purchased her top mast. It still stands there today at the ground - now owned by Liverpool Football Club (formed 1892), at the Kop end. In 2011, the Channel 4 programme "Time Team" found geophysical survey evidence to suggest that residual iron parts from the ship's keel and lower structure still reside in the foreshore.
During 1859, when "Great Eastern" was off Portland conducting trials, an explosion aboard blew off one of the funnels. The funnel was salvaged and subsequently purchased by the water company supplying Weymouth and Melcombe Regis in Dorset, UK, and used as a filtering device. It was later transferred to the Bristol Maritime Museum close to Brunel's SS "Great Britain" then moved to the SS "Great Britain" museum.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Jonathan Swift
Content: Jonathan Swift est né le 30 novembre 1667 à Dublin, en Irlande. Il était le deuxième enfant et fils unique de Jonathan Swift (1640-1667) et de son épouse Abigail Erick (ou Herrick) de Frisby sur le Wreake. Son père était originaire de Goodrich, Herefordshire, mais il a accompagné ses frères en Irlande pour demander leur fortune en droit après que la succession de leur père royaliste a été amenée en ruine pendant la guerre civile anglaise. Son grand-père maternel, James Ericke, était le vicaire de Thornton, en Angleterre. En 1634, le vicaire a été reconnu coupable de pratiques puritaines. Par la suite, Ericke et sa famille, dont sa jeune fille Abilgail, ont fui en Irlande.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: A Tale of a Tub
Content: Born of English parents in Ireland, Jonathan Swift was working as Sir William Temple's secretary at the time he composed "A Tale of a Tub" (1694–1697). The publication of the work coincided with Swift's striking out on his own, having despaired of getting a good "living" from Temple or Temple's influence. There is speculation about what caused the rift between Swift and his employer, but, as A. C. Elias persuasively argues, it seems that the final straw came with Swift's work on Temple's "Letters." Swift had been engaged to translate Temple's French correspondence, but Temple, or someone close to Temple, edited the French text to make Temple seem both prescient and more fluent. Consequently, the letters and the translations Swift provided did not gibe, and, since Swift could not accuse Temple of falsifying his letters, and because the public would never believe that the retired state minister had lied, Swift came across as incompetent.
Even though Swift published the "Tale" as he left Temple's service, it was conceived earlier, and the book is a salvo in one of Temple's battles. Swift's general polemic concerns an argument (the "Quarrel of the Ancients and the Moderns") that had been over for nearly ten years by the time the book was published. The "Quarrel of the Ancients and Moderns" was a French academic debate of the early 1690s, occasioned by Fontenelle arguing that modern scholarship had allowed modern man to surpass the ancients in knowledge. Temple argued against this position in his "On Ancient and Modern Learning" (where he provided the first English formulation of the commonplace that modern critics see more only because they are dwarves standing on the shoulders of giants), and Temple's somewhat naive essay prompted a small flurry of responses. Among others, two men who took the side opposing Temple were Richard Bentley (classicist and editor) and William Wotton (critic).
---

La profondeur moyenne du lac est de 46 brasses de 3 pieds (279 pi; 85 m), tandis que sa plus grande profondeur est de 153 brasses de 5 pieds (923 pi; 281 m). Il contient un volume de 1 180 milles cubes (4 918 km³) d'eau. Green Bay dans le nord-ouest est sa plus grande baie. Grand Traverse Bay dans son nord-est est une autre grande baie. La région la plus profonde du lac Michigan, qui se trouve dans sa mi-temps nord, est appelée bassin de Chippewa (du nom de Prehistoric Lake Chippewa) et est séparée du bassin du Chippewa du sud, par une zone relativement moins profonde appelée le plateau du lac Mid.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Nerf optique
Content: Le nerf optique quitte l'orbite (socket pour les yeux) via le canal optique, fonctionnant postéro-médial vers le chiasme optique, où il y a une décussation partielle (traversée) des fibres des champs visuels temporels (l'hémi-rétina nasal) des deux yeux. La proportion de fibres décussantes varie entre les espèces et est corrélée avec le degré de vision binoculaire dont bénéficient une espèce. La plupart des axones du nerf optique se terminent dans le noyau géniculé latéral à partir de l'endroit où l'information est relayée au cortex visuel, tandis que d'autres axones se terminent dans le noyau prétectal et sont impliqués dans des mouvements oculaires réflexifs. D'autres axones se terminent dans le noyau suprachiasmatique et sont impliqués dans la régulation du cycle veille du sommeil. Son diamètre passe d'environ 1,6 mm dans l'œil à 3,5 mm dans l'orbite à 4,5 mm dans l'espace crânien. Les longueurs des composants du nerf optique sont de 1 mm dans le globe, 24 mm sur l'orbite, 9 mm dans le canal optique et 16 mm dans l'espace crânien avant de rejoindre le chiasme optique. Là, une décussation partielle se produit et environ 53% des fibres se croisent pour former les voies optiques. La plupart de ces fibres se terminent dans le corps géniculé latéral.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Optic nerve
Content: The optic nerve is the second of twelve paired cranial nerves and is technically part of the central nervous system, rather than the peripheral nervous system because it is derived from an out-pouching of the diencephalon (optic stalks) during embryonic development. As a consequence, the fibers of the optic nerve are covered with myelin produced by oligodendrocytes, rather than Schwann cells of the peripheral nervous system, and are encased within the meninges. Peripheral neuropathies like Guillain–Barré syndrome do not affect the optic nerve. However, most typically the optic nerve is grouped with the other eleven cranial nerves and considered to be part of the peripheral nervous system.
---

Title: Ashley Montagu
Content: One of his works, "Man's Most Dangerous Myth", was written while race was considered the determinant of people's character and intelligence (Rowman and Littlefield). Montagu presented a unique theory for his time: "in biology race is defined as a subdivision of species which inherits physical characteristics distinguishing it from other populations of the species. In this sense there are many human 'races.' But this is not the sense in which many anthropologists, race-classifiers, and racists have used the term." He admits that in a biological sense, there is the existence of races within mankind. However, he also believes that not all of mankind can be classified. Part of his reasoning has to do with mixed origin, which has resulted in “overlapping” of physicalities. Instead of races and subspecies, he prefers mixed ethnic groups. His writing further emphasizes the complexity of our descent and rejects claims that support one race being superior when compared to others. He also says profoundly that the "so-called" main divisions of mankind are species instead of races.

Le bâtiment de l'école a été conçu par John Francis Bentley, également responsable de la cathédrale de Westminster. Title: Westminster Cathedral
Content: The founder of Westminster Cathedral, Cardinal Herbert Vaughan laid great emphasis on the beauty and integrity of the cathedral's liturgy. Initially, he determined there should be a community of Benedictine monks at the new cathedral, performing the liturgies and singing the daily Office. This caused great resentment amongst the secular clergy of the diocese, who felt they were being snubbed. In the end, negotiations with both the English Benedictines and the community of French Benedictines at Farnborough failed and a 'traditional' choir of men and boys was set up instead. Despite great financial problems, the Choir School opened on 5 October 1901 with eleven boy choristers, in the building originally intended for the Benedictine monks. Cardinal Vaughan received the boys with the words "You are the foundation stones". The Cathedral Choir was officially instituted three months later in January 1902. Sung Masses and Offices were immediately established when the cathedral opened for worship in 1903, and have continued without interruption ever since. Today, Westminster Cathedral Choir is the only professional Catholic choir in the world to sing daily Mass and Vespers.

Content: Les masses moléculaires sont calculées à partir des poids atomiques standard de chaque nucléde, tandis que les masses molaires sont calculées à partir de la masse atomique de chaque élément. La masse atomique prend en compte la distribution isotopique de l'élément dans un échantillon donné (généralement supposé être "normal"). Par exemple, l'eau a une masse molaire de 18,0153 (3) g / mol, mais les molécules d'eau individuelles ont des masses moléculaires qui varient entre 18,010 564 6863 (15) U (HO) et 22.027 7364 (9) U (DO).

The molecular weight cutoff of commercially available microdialysis probes covers a wide range of approximately 6-100kD, but also 1MD is available. While water-soluble compounds generally diffuse freely across the microdialysis membrane, the situation is not as clear for highly lipophilic analytes, where both successful (e.g. corticosteroids) and unsuccessful microdialysis experiments (e.g. estradiol, fusidic acid) have been reported. However, the recovery of water-soluble compounds usually decreases rapidly if the molecular weight of the analyte exceeds 25% of the membrane’s molecular weight cutoff.

Title: Histoire de la nationalité néerlandaise
Content: Même si les gouvernements urbains ont montré de rares signes de démocratie, ils étaient principalement un système oligarchique marqué par une hiérarchie exclusive. Les divisions de classe, cependant, n'étaient pas aussi profondes que dans les autres États européens, et les droits que possédaient la classe commune ne différaient pas beaucoup de ce que les intellectuels pouvaient pratiquer. Il y avait une harmonie culturelle et cela a empêché la formation de deux classes complètement divisées et a permis une participation sociale de tous. De même, la base de l'éducation était la même pour tous, ce qui a permis un lien social. La différence de droits que possédait les classes supérieures et inférieures a été réduite à la somme d'argent disponible pour l'individu. Si l'on était riche, il pouvait se permettre une éducation de niveau supérieur. Cependant, cela à lui seul ne lui a valu aucun privilège politique ou droits politiques étendus, mais seulement la capacité de gagner plus de richesse. 
L'ensemble de la population de la République néerlandaise n'avait pas le choix de voter pour le représentant du pays dans la mesure où il n'y avait pas un choix entre une démocratie et une aristocratie mais plutôt entre une aristocratie et une monarchie. Le stadtholder serait membre de la Chambre d'Orange-Nassau.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Théorie des cellules
Content: En biologie, la théorie des cellules est la théorie scientifique historique, désormais universellement acceptée, que les organismes vivants sont constitués de cellules, qu'ils sont l'unité structurelle / organisationnelle de base de tous les organismes, et que toutes les cellules proviennent de cellules préexistantes. Les cellules sont l'unité de base de la structure dans tous les organismes et également l'unité de base de reproduction. Avec des améliorations continues apportées aux microscopes au fil du temps, la technologie de grossissement a avancé suffisamment pour découvrir les cellules au 17ème siècle. Cette découverte est largement attribuée à Robert Hooke et a commencé l'étude scientifique des cellules, également connue sous le nom de biologie cellulaire. Plus d'un siècle plus tard, de nombreux débats sur les cellules ont commencé parmi les scientifiques. La plupart de ces débats impliquaient la nature de la régénération cellulaire et l'idée des cellules comme unité fondamentale de vie. La théorie des cellules a finalement été formulée en 1839. Ceci est généralement crédité à Matthias Schleiden et Theodor Schwann. Cependant, de nombreux autres scientifiques comme Rudolf Virchow ont contribué à la théorie. Ce fut une étape importante dans le mouvement loin de la génération spontanée.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: University of Toronto
Content: The discovery of insulin at the University of Toronto in 1921 is considered among the most significant events in the history of medicine. The stem cell was discovered at the university in 1963, forming the basis for bone marrow transplantation and all subsequent research on adult and embryonic stem cells. This was the first of many findings at Toronto relating to stem cells, including the identification of pancreatic and retinal stem cells. The cancer stem cell was first identified in 1997 by Toronto researchers, who have since found stem cell associations in leukemia, brain tumors and colorectal cancer. Medical inventions developed at Toronto include the glycaemic index, the infant cereal Pablum, the use of protective hypothermia in open heart surgery and the first artificial cardiac pacemaker. The first successful single-lung transplant was performed at Toronto in 1981, followed by the first nerve transplant in 1988, and the first double-lung transplant in 1989. Researchers identified the maturation promoting factor that regulates cell division, and discovered the T-cell receptor, which triggers responses of the immune system. The university is credited with isolating the genes that cause Fanconi anemia, cystic fibrosis and early-onset Alzheimer's disease, among numerous other diseases. Between 1914 and 1972, the university operated the Connaught Medical Research Laboratories, now part of the pharmaceutical corporation Sanofi-Aventis. Among the research conducted at the laboratory was the development of gel electrophoresis.
---

Title: Enzyme digestive
Content: Les enzymes digestives sont un groupe d'enzymes qui décomposent les macromolécules polymères dans leurs petits éléments de construction, afin de faciliter leur absorption par le corps. Les enzymes digestives se trouvent dans les voies digestives des animaux (y compris les humains) et dans les pièges des plantes carnivores, où elles aident à la digestion des aliments, ainsi que dans les cellules intérieures, en particulier dans leurs lysosomes, où elles fonctionnent pour maintenir la survie cellulaire. ---

Title: Planarian
Content: The planarian has very simple organ systems. The digestive system consists of a mouth, pharynx, and a gastrovascular cavity. The mouth is located in the center of the underside of the body. Digestive enzymes are secreted from the mouth to begin external digestion. The pharynx connects the mouth to the gastrovascular cavity. This structure branches throughout the body allowing nutrients from food to reach all extremities. Planaria eat living or dead small animals that they suck up with their muscular mouths. Food passes from the mouth through the pharynx into the intestines where it is digested by the cells lining the intestines. Then its nutrients diffuse to the rest of the planaria.
