Pourquoi le flux thermique d'Uranus est si faible n'est toujours pas compris. Neptune, qui est presque jumeau d'Uranus en taille et en composition, rayonne 2,61 fois plus d'énergie dans l'espace qu'il reçoit du soleil. En fait, le flux de chaleur d'Uranus n'est que w / m², ce qui est inférieur au flux de chaleur interne de la Terre d'environ 0,075 w / m². La température la plus basse enregistrée dans la tropopause d'Uranus est de 49 K (−224 ° C), faisant d'Uranus la planète la plus froide du système solaire, plus froide que Neptune.

Content: La zone de faille de Koa’e (prononcé Coe-Wah-hee) est une série de escarpements de faille reliant les zones de rift est et sud-ouest sur le volcan Kilauea sur la grande île d'Hawaï. La zone de faille recoupe la faille est près du cratère de Pauahi et s'étend sur près de 12 kilomètres dans une direction est-nord-est vers la frontière la plus à l'ouest près de Mauna Iki et la zone du rift sud-ouest. Les limites de la zone de faille Koa’e couvrent également 2 kilomètres dans une orientation nord-sud le long de la longueur de 12 kilomètres. On pense que la zone de faille est active depuis des dizaines de milliers d'années. Document ID: 2
Title: Teton Fault
Content: The Teton fault is located in a unique geologic setting. The fault is on the boundary of four major geologic provinces: the Basin and Range, Idaho-Wyoming Thrust belt, Rocky Mountain Foreland, and the Yellowstone volcanic plateau. The Basin and Range province is a region of east-west crustal extension. This province adds tension perpendicular to the fault line causing the fault blocks to move apart. The Idaho-Wyoming Thrust belt is located south of the Teton fault and is a region of thick and deformed crust that prevents the fault from extending farther south. The Rocky Mountain Foreland is located east of the Teton fault and is a region of thicker crust. This section of crust is heavier and adds to the vertical downward force on the hanging wall of fault. The Yellowstone volcanic plateau is a region of uplift and expansion that influences both vertical and horizontal forces on the Teton fault.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Eugene Sternberg
Content: Eugene Sternberg (15 janvier 1915 - 5 juin 2005) était un architecte américain né austro-hongrois connu pour son engagement passionné et sa contribution à l'architecture contemporaine / moderniste et à la planification de la ville au Colorado et à d'autres États de montagne rocheux entre 1950 et 1990. Étant donné que son objectif était d'améliorer la qualité de vie de la population générale, les structures qu'il a construites étaient belles, utiles et rentables. La plupart de ses projets figuraient dans la catégorie de l'architecture sociale: maisons abordables, projets de logements pour personnes âgées, logement public, hôpitaux, cliniques médicales, écoles publiques, collèges communautaires, centres communautaires, églises, bâtiments pour coopératives de crédit, syndicats et bureaux du siège pour les associations électriques rurales. En tant que planificateur, Sternberg a conçu un certain nombre de lotissements innovants et de plans principaux pour les campus universitaires, les complexes gouvernementaux, le champ de foire du comté et un certain nombre de petites villes occidentales.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Eugene Sternberg
Content: Sternberg was born during World War I in Pressburg, Austria-Hungary where his family had moved to be with his father while he served in the Austro-Hungarian army. When the war, and the Austro-Hungarian Empire, ended in 1918, the family returned to their home in Munkács (now Mukachevo, Ukraine) in the province of Ruthenia; in 1920 it became part of the newly created country of Czechoslovakia.
During his elementary and high school education. Sternberg's major passion was art. He developed into an accomplished young artist and won a coveted place to study architecture at the Czech Technical University in Prague. In the summers he worked for two architectural firms in Munkács and for a well-known Czech architect, Frantisek Libra, in Prague. In 1938, he earned a first degree in architecture/engineering. Adolf Hitler's Germany occupied Czechoslovakia in March 1939. Because Sternberg was offered a scholarship to the University of London's Bartlett School of Architecture he was fortunate to leave Czechoslovakia in 1939, the only one of his large Jewish family to be able to do so.
---

claim: Fiji is an island nation in the South-West Pacific Ocean, located roughly midway between its nearest neighbours Vanuatu to the west and Tonga to the east
question_en: Where is Fiji located in the world?
report_en: Fiji is an island nation in the South-West Pacific Ocean, located roughly midway between its nearest neighbours Vanuatu to the west and Tonga to the east [1]. The archipelago spreads across longitudes 176° 53′ E to 178° 12′ W, with the 180° meridian slicing through the island of Taveuni; however, the International Date Line bends around the group so the entire country observes the same time zone (UTC+12) [1]. Most of Fiji’s islands lie between latitudes 15° 42′ S and 20° 02′ S, placing them in the tropical southern hemisphere, while the outlying dependency of Rotuma sits farther north at about 12° 30′ S [1].

claim: Zombies was first released for Microsoft Windows and OS X on 5 May 2009, launching simultaneously on Steam that same day
question_en: When was the game Plants vs. Zombies released?
report_en: Plants vs. Zombies was first released for Microsoft Windows and OS X on 5 May 2009, launching simultaneously on Steam that same day [1]. Subsequent ports followed: iOS in February 2010, an Xbox Live Arcade version with extra modes on 8 September 2010, Nintendo DS on 18 January 2011, PlayStation 3 in February 2011, Android via Amazon Appstore on 31 May 2011 and on Google Play on 14 December 2011, BlackBerry PlayBook on 16 February 2012, and BlackBerry 10 smartphones in January 2013; the original PC/Mac edition was also re-released as a “Game of the Year” version, and a free ad-supported iOS edition appeared in January 2015 [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Plantes vs zombies
Content: Plantes vs Zombies est un jeu vidéo de la défense de la tour développé et publié à l'origine par les jeux PopCap pour Microsoft Windows et OS X. Le jeu implique que les propriétaires qui utilisent une variété de plantes différentes pour empêcher une armée de zombies d'entrer dans leurs maisons et de "manger leur cerveau". Il a été publié pour la première fois le 5 mai 2009 et mis à disposition sur Steam le même jour. Une version pour iOS a été publiée en février 2010 et une version HD pour l'iPad. Une version étendue de la Xbox Live Arcade présentant de nouveaux modes et fonctionnalités de jeu a été publié le 8 septembre 2010. POPCAP a publié une version Nintendo DS le 18 janvier 2011 avec un contenu unique à la plate-forme. La version PlayStation 3 a été publiée en février 2011 également avec des nouveaux modes coopératifs et versus ajoutés dans la version Xbox 360. Une version Android du jeu a été publiée le 31 mai 2011 sur l'Amazon Appstore, alors qu'elle a également été publiée sur le marché Android (maintenant Google Play) le 14 décembre 2011. Le 16 février 2012, une version a été publiée pour Blackberry PlayBook. Plus tard, une version smartphone BlackBerry du jeu a été publiée en janvier 2013 après le lancement de Blackberry 10. De plus, la version Windows et Mac originale du jeu a été réédité avec un contenu supplémentaire dans une version "Game of the Year". En janvier 2015, une version gratuite du jeu apportée à la publicité a été publiée pour iOS.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Plants vs. Zombies Heroes
Content: Plants vs. Zombies Heroes is a digital collectible card game in the "Plants vs. Zombies" series, developed by PopCap Games and published by Electronic Arts. On March 10, 2016, it underwent a soft launch in some countries on iOS, before being internationally released on October 18, 2016. This is the first mobile release in the "Plants vs Zombies" series in which players can play as either a Plant or a Zombie.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Paavo Berglund
Content: Selon la société finlandaise de radiodiffusion Yle, le violon Stradivarius de Berglund a été vendu par ses héritiers en 2012 à la Fondation culturelle finlandaise pour 1,8 million d'euros. Dans le même temps, les droits de l'artiste interprète sur les enregistrements de Berglund ainsi que sa précieuse collection de partitions orchestrales ont été donnés à la Fondation. Ce dernier matériel sera mis à la disposition des chercheurs dans dix ans. Le violon sera nommé Stradivarius ex. Berglund. Le fils de M. Berglund, Juha Berglund, le porte-parole de la famille, dit que son père avait plusieurs instruments, mais le Stradivari était le plus cher pour lui. Le souhait spécifique de M. Berglund était que le violon reste en Finlande. Le violon a été construit vers 1700. Le violon est en état exceptionnellement bon pour son âge.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Henri Temianka
Content: In his teens Temianka played a Laurentius Storioni of 1780. While traveling under the aegis of the Curtis Institute, he briefly played a loaned Stradivarius, which was exchanged for a Januarius Gagliano. In 1929 Temianka owned the violin made in 1752 by Joannes Baptista Guadagnini. In the 1930s he played a Silvestre violin, with which he made his early Vintage recordings, and subsequently a Januarius Gagliano and a Carlo Bergonzi.
The Stradivarius he played during the years of the Paganini Quartet was the "Comte Cozio di Salabue" of 1727, which was Paganini's own concert violin. It was later played by Martin Beaver, first violinist of the Tokyo String Quartet, which played since 1995 on the same quartet of Stradivarius instruments once owned by Paganini, until the Tokyo String Quartet retired in July 2013. These remarkable instruments—the viola had inspired Paganini to commission Hector Berlioz's "Harold en Italie"—were also played by the Cleveland Quartet for almost 15 years, beginning in 1982, and are presently owned by Nippon Music Foundation of Japan, after deacquisition by the Corcoran Gallery in the mid-1990s for $15 million. They were then played for several years by the Hagen Quartet, and are now in the hands of the Quartetto di Cremona.
When the years of the Paganini Quartet came to an end, Temianka played a Michelangelo Bergonzi of 1759. His recordings of the Handel Sonatas were made on an Andrea Guarneri of 1687.In February 2013, Chapman University endowed the Henri Temianka Professorship in Music and Scholarship in String Studies. The violin played by Albert Saparoff, concertmaster of the Hollywood Symphony, was endowed as the Temianka-Saparoff violin, and is dedicated for the use of a selected recipient while studying there.
---

En vertu des seigneurs se trouvaient d'autres sujets tels que les serfs, qui étaient liés et obligés envers leurs seigneurs et les obligations de leurs seigneurs. Les commerçants avaient un statut spécial dans le système, tout comme les Juifs. Les Juifs ont été déclarés comme des sujets directs du roi, contrairement au reste de la population. C'était une position juridique ambivalente pour la population juive, en ce sens qu'ils n'étaient liés à aucun seigneur particulier mais étaient soumis aux caprices du roi, il pouvait être avantageux ou désavantageux. Chaque roi successif a officiellement examiné une charte royale, accordant aux Juifs le droit de rester en Angleterre. Les Juifs n'ont apprécié aucune des garanties de la Magna Carta de 1215.

In addition to many arbitrary taxes, Richard I established the Ordinance of the Jewry in 1194 in an attempt to organize the Jewish community. It ensured that mandatory records would be kept by royal officials for all Jewish transactions. Every debt was recorded on a chirography to allow the king immediate and complete access to Jewish property. Richard also established a special exchequer to collect any unpaid debts due after the death of a Jewish creditor. The establishment of the Exchequer of the Jews eventually made all transactions of the English Jewry liable to taxation by the king in addition to the 10% of all sums recovered by Jews with the help of English courts. So, while the First and Second Crusades increased anti-Jewish sentiments, Jews in England went relatively unscathed beyond occasional fines and special levies. Though they did not experience the same kind of social mobility and cultural advancements that Jews under Muslim rule did, the Jews of England's population and prosperity increased under the protection of the king.

Content: La Déclaration des droits, également connue sous le nom de Déclaration des droits anglaises, est un acte du Parlement de l'Angleterre qui établit certains droits civils fondamentaux et clarifie qui serait à côté de l'hériter de la Couronne. Il a reçu l'assentiment royal le 16 décembre 1689 et est un retraitement sous forme statutaire de la Déclaration de droit présentée par le Parlement de la Convention à William III et Mary II en février 1689, les invitant à devenir des souverains conjoints d'Angleterre. La Déclaration des droits limite les pouvoirs du monarque et définit les droits du Parlement, y compris l'exigence de parlements réguliers, d'élections libres et de liberté d'expression au Parlement. Il établit certains droits des individus, notamment l'interdiction d'une sanction cruelle et inhabituelle et a rétabli le droit des protestants d'avoir des armes pour leur défense dans l'état de droit. En outre, la Déclaration des droits a décrit et condamné plusieurs méfaits de James II d'Angleterre.

Title: United States Bill of Rights
Content: The Bill of Rights in the United States is the first ten amendments to the United States Constitution. Proposed following the often bitter 1787–88 debate over ratification of the U.S. Constitution, and written to address the objections raised by Anti-Federalists, the Bill of Rights amendments add to the Constitution specific guarantees of personal freedoms and rights, clear limitations on the government's power in judicial and other proceedings, and explicit declarations that all powers not specifically delegated to Congress by the Constitution are reserved for the states or the people. The concepts codified in these amendments are built upon those found in several earlier documents, including the Virginia Declaration of Rights and the English Bill of Rights, along with earlier documents such as Magna Carta (1215). In practice, the amendments had little impact on judgments by the courts for the first 150 years after ratification.

Content: Julius Caesar Chappelle (1852-1904) était un politicien afro-américain né en esclavage en Caroline du Sud. Après la guerre civile américaine, il a vécu pendant un certain temps avec sa famille à Lavilla, en Floride, aidant à développer la nouvelle ville. En 1870, il était l'un des nombreux migrants noirs du sud de Boston, Massachusetts, qui avait une communauté noire florissante et une forte histoire abolitionniste. Il a ensuite rejoint le Parti républicain fondé par des abolitionnistes, et Chappelle a été élue à deux mandats de la législature de l'État du Massachusetts, au service de 1883-1886. Julius Caesar Chappelle a également été le premier afro-américain à siéger au Comité du Sénat de l'État du Massachusetts où il a servi trois mandats. Chappelle était actif dans le soutien des droits civils, tentant de réduire la discrimination et la consommation. Ses discours étaient fréquemment couverts par des journaux. Tout au long de sa vie et de sa carrière politique, il a occupé des postes de gouvernement de supervision secondaire dans la maintenance, comme au bureau de poste des États-Unis et à la maison de douane américaine de Boston. Bien que Julius Caesar Chappelle ait peut-être honoré les mêmes pages dans les journaux que Frederick Douglass, Chappelle n'est pas aussi bien connue car il n'est pas connu pour avoir laissé une grande empreinte littéraire telle que l'écriture de manuscrits ou pour des brochures.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Vigilants du Montana
Content: L'histoire de la justice vigilante et des justiciers du Montana a commencé en 1863 dans ce qui était à l'époque une partie éloignée du territoire de l'est de l'Idaho. Les activités de vigilance se sont poursuivies, bien que quelque peu sporadiquement, à travers la période territoriale du Montana jusqu'à ce que le territoire devienne l'État du Montana le 8 novembre 1889. Le vigilance est apparu parce que les forces de l'ordre territoriales et les tribunaux avaient très peu de pouvoir dans les camps minières éloignés pendant la période territoriale.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Montana Vigilantes
Content: The first written account of the vigilantes was Thomas Dimsdale's "Vigilantes of Montana" which first appeared as a series of articles in 1865 editions of the "Montana Post", Virginia City's and Montana's first newspaper. Dimsdale was a member of the Alder Gulch Vigilance Committee and editor of the "Montana Post." His early accounts of the Alder Gulch vigilante events are widely cited and the book version of his articles, the first book published in Montana Territory in 1866, has been extensively reprinted since its first edition.
X. Biedler, one of the Alder Gulch and Helena vigilante enforcers wrote about his vigilante activities in his personal journals. They weren't available until well after his death when Helen F. Sanders, the daughter-in-law of Wilbur Sanders finally got them published in 1957. Nathaniel Langford, also a member of the vigilantes, explorer of the upper Yellowstone (1870), first superintendent of Yellowstone National Park (1872–1877), territorial tax collector (1864–1869) and author published "Vigilante Days and Ways-Pioneers of the Rockies" in 1893 after he returned to his home in Minnesota. In a 1912 speech to the Montana Historical Society, western historian, Olin Wheeler provided positive commentary on the Alder Gulch vigilantes in a tribute to the life of Nathaniel Langford.
Another account, not published until 1982, is that of former Montana Supreme Court Justice (1922–1935) Lew L. Callaway. Edited by his son Lew Callaway Jr., "Montana's Righteous Hangmen:The Vigilantes in Action" stems from Callaway's association with vigilante Captain James William in the late 1800s. Lew Callaway wrote extensively about the vigilantes and his stories which add more intimate details about how the vigilantes operated are captured in this volume. Although some vigilante activities during this period were criticized by citizens and civic leaders, there was a general affirmation of their purpose and contribution to law and order in a growing territory. Mark C. Dillon's "Montana Vigilantes 1863–1870 Gold, Guns and Gallows" (2013) concludes that given the lawless environment and criminal activity in Alder Gulch and Helena at the time, the lack of any functioning justice system and the understanding of due process at the time, the vigilantes acted in a way they thought was best for their communities. He contends that judging the vigilantes by today's understanding and standards of due process is problematic.
In 2004, Frederick Allen, a journalist and historian, published "A Decent and Orderly Lynching:The Montana Vigilantes" reviewed as an up-to-day balanced account of Montana's vigilante history (1864–1870). Allen's book reinforces the motivations and methods of the earliest vigilantes in Alder Gulch while commenting on the growing disdain for vigilantism in the late 1860s. More generalist works on Montana history such as Merrill G. Burlingame's "The Montana Frontier" (1942) and Michael P. Malone's "Montana-A History of Two Centuries" (1991) adequately summarize the vigilante period largely based on earlier accounts by Dimsdale, Langford and Biedler. Additionally, many topical histories of Montana, such as novelist and Montana historian Dan Cushman's "Montana: The Gold Frontier" (1973) cover the vigilante period.
---

Title: Windows XP
Content: Despite the approaching end of support, there were still notable holdouts that had not migrated past XP; many users elected to remain on XP because of the poor reception of Windows Vista, sales of newer PCs with newer versions of Windows declined due to the Great Recession and the effects of Vista, and deployments of new versions of Windows in enterprise environments require a large amount of planning, which includes testing applications for compatibility (especially those that are dependent on Internet Explorer 6, which is not compatible with newer versions of Windows). Major security software vendors (including Microsoft itself) planned to continue offering support and definitions for Windows XP past the end of support to varying extents, along with the developers of Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, and Opera web browsers; despite these measures, critics similarly argued that users should eventually migrate from XP to a supported platform. The United States' Computer Emergency Readiness Team released an alert in March 2014 advising users of the impending end of support, and informing them that using XP after April 8 may prevent them from meeting US government information security requirements.
Microsoft continued to provide Security Essentials virus definitions and updates for its Malicious Software Removal Tool (MSRT) for XP until July 14, 2015. As the end of extended support approached, Microsoft began to increasingly urge XP customers to migrate to newer versions such as Windows 7 or 8 in the interest of security, suggesting that attackers could reverse engineer security patches for newer versions of Windows and use them to target equivalent vulnerabilities in XP. Windows XP is remotely exploitable by numerous security holes that were discovered after Microsoft stopped supporting it.

The circuit uses the roads skirting the city's harbour and America's Cup port area – including a section over a swing bridge, and also includes some roads designed exclusively for racing purposes by the German architect Hermann Tilke, who also designed the infrastructure buildings for the circuit. The 2012 edition took place on 24 June and was the last to go under the name of the European Grand Prix until 2016, when the Baku City Circuit used the title for one year. It has not been used since 2013 after a deal fell through to alternate this venue with Catalunya in Barcelona to host the Spanish Grand Prix.

Massless ropes, point particles, ideal gases and the particle in a box are among the many simplified models used in physics. The laws of physics are represented with simple equations such as Newton's laws, Maxwell's equations and the Schrödinger equation. These laws are such as a basis for making mathematical models of real situations. Many real situations are very complex and thus modeled approximate on a computer, a model that is computationally feasible to compute is made from the basic laws or from approximate models made from the basic laws. For example, molecules can be modeled by molecular orbital models that are approximate solutions to the Schrödinger equation. In engineering, physics models are often made by mathematical methods such as finite element analysis.

claim: Greed—defined as an intense desire for more—can sometimes promote beneficial outcomes because the pursuit of personal gain often spurs risk-taking, efficiency improvements, and innovation that raise overall wealth; proponents such as financier Ivan Boesky argued in a 1986 Berkeley commencement address that “greed is healthy” and compatible with self-respect, a stance dramatized by Gordon Gekko’s “greed is good” speech in the 1987 film “Wall Street,” which claims greed “clarifies, cuts through, and captures the essence of the evolutionary spirit”
question_en: Can greed be a good thing?
report_en: Greed—defined as an intense desire for more—can sometimes promote beneficial outcomes because the pursuit of personal gain often spurs risk-taking, efficiency improvements, and innovation that raise overall wealth; proponents such as financier Ivan Boesky argued in a 1986 Berkeley commencement address that “greed is healthy” and compatible with self-respect, a stance dramatized by Gordon Gekko’s “greed is good” speech in the 1987 film “Wall Street,” which claims greed “clarifies, cuts through, and captures the essence of the evolutionary spirit” [1]. By motivating individuals to work harder, invest, and compete, greed can increase productivity and expand markets, much as Adam Smith’s “invisible hand” describes self-interest unintentionally benefiting society. However, when unchecked by regulation or ethical norms, greed can also fuel fraud, inequality, and systemic risk—Boesky himself was later jailed for insider trading—so the key question is not whether greed can ever be good, but whether institutions channel it toward socially constructive ends while limiting its destructive potential.

claim: children in 1990, rates of acute Hepatitis B have fallen by 82 %, demonstrating both the virus’s prior ease of transmission and the effectiveness of immunization in curbing its spread
question_en: Is Hepatitis contagious?
report_en: Yes—Hepatitis B is a contagious virus that infects the liver and can spread from an infected person to others, manifesting as either a short-term acute illness or a long-term chronic condition [1]. Because the virus is readily transmissible at birth, about 90 % of infants who acquire it develop chronic infection, whereas the risk decreases as children get older [1]. Since the vaccine became routine for U.S. children in 1990, rates of acute Hepatitis B have fallen by 82 %, demonstrating both the virus’s prior ease of transmission and the effectiveness of immunization in curbing its spread [1].

Title: Champ magnétique de la Terre
Content: Le champ magnétique de la Terre, également connu sous le nom de champ géomagnétique, est le champ magnétique qui s'étend de l'intérieur de la Terre dans l'espace, où il rencontre le vent solaire, un flux de particules chargées émanant du soleil. Son ampleur à la surface de la Terre varie de 25 à 65 microtesales (0,25 à 0,65 Gauss). En approximativement, c'est le champ d'un dipôle magnétique actuellement incliné à un angle d'environ 11 degrés par rapport à l'axe de rotation de la Terre, comme s'il y avait un aimant de barre placé à cet angle au centre de la terre. Le poteau géomagnétique du Nord, situé près du Groenland dans l'hémisphère nord, est en fait le pôle Sud du champ magnétique terrestre, et le pôle géomagnétique sud est le pôle Nord. Le champ magnétique est généré par les courants électriques en raison du mouvement des courants de convection de fer en fusion dans le noyau extérieur de la Terre entraîné par la chaleur s'échappant du noyau, un processus naturel appelé géodnamo.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Omnivore
Content: Divers mammifères sont omnivores dans la nature, comme les espèces de porcs, les blaireaux, les ours, les coéris, les civettes, les hérissons, les opossums, les mouffettes, les paresseux, les écureuils, les ratons laveurs, les fumulers, les souris et les rats. Les hominidés, y compris les humains et les chimpanzés, sont également des omnivores.
La plupart des espèces d'ours sont des omnivores, mais les régimes individuels peuvent aller de presque exclusivement herbivores à presque exclusivement carnivores, selon les sources de nourriture disponibles localement et de saison. Les ours polaires sont classés comme carnivores, tous deux taxonomiquement (ils sont dans l'ordre carnivora), et de manière comportementale (ils subsistent sur un régime largement carnivore). Selon les espèces d'ours, il y a généralement une préférence pour une classe de nourriture, car les plantes et les animaux sont digérés différemment. Les sous-espèces de loups (y compris les loups, les chiens, les dingos et les coyotes) mangent une matière végétale, mais ils ont une préférence générale et sont destinés à l'évolution vers la viande. En outre, le loup à faille est un canid dont le régime alimentaire est naturellement 50% de matière végétale.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Cave of the Angel
Content: It is remarkable the almost complete absence of carnivores, which are only represented by a few bones of "Ursus arctos", "Lynx pardinus" and "Canis lupus". The occurrence of carnivores in other sites, as in Boquete de Zafarraya, alternates with human presence in the stratigraphy. This event is interpreted as a seasonal occupation of the site by humans. When humans leave this habitat, carnivores take place of the site. Since this situation is not observed at Cave of the Angel, and moreover, there is no interruption in the stratigraphy of human presence, it is likely that a long term human occupation took place. In contrast, the existence of those few carnivore remains can be explained as the result of human consumption as so it happens with rabbit remains ("Oryctolagus cuniculus").

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Solide
Content: Les gens utilisent des polymères organiques naturels depuis des siècles sous la forme de cires et de gomme à cacher, qui est classé comme un polymère thermoplastique. Un polymère végétal nommé cellulose a fourni la résistance à la traction pour les fibres et les cordes naturelles, et au début du caoutchouc naturel du XIXe siècle était largement utilisée. Les polymères sont les matières premières (les résines) utilisées pour fabriquer ce que l'on appelle communément les plastiques. Les plastiques sont le produit final, créé après qu'un ou plusieurs polymères ou additifs ont été ajoutés à une résine pendant le traitement, qui est ensuite façonné en forme finale. Les polymères qui ont existé et qui sont en cours d'usage généralisé, comprennent le polyéthylène à base de carbone, le polypropylène, le chlorure de polyvinyle, le polystyrène, les nylons, les polyesters, les acryliques, le polyuréthane et les polycarbonates et les silicones à base de silicium. Les plastiques sont généralement classés comme "marchandises", "spécialités" et "ingénierie" plastiques.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Sequence-controlled polymer
Content: DNA, RNA and proteins are most common sequence-controlled polymers in living creatures. Inspired by them, polymerization methods, utilizing DNA or RNA as templates to control sequences of polymer, are developed. At first, taking DNA or RNA as templates, scientists developed a series of peptide nucleic acid (PNA)-based polymers, without using DNA polymerases. But this method is limited to polymerization scale and yield. After that, polymerase chain reaction (PCR) is developed, which currently is still the most extensively used sequence-regulated method. By employing enzymes, the yields and scales are greatly increased, but the specificity of enzymes towards natural peptides limits this technique to a certain degree. Nowadays, more attention is paid to utilization of ribosomes to directly mimic the transcription and translation process. This technology called protein engineering is considered as the most promising biological polymerization method for synthesis of sequence-controlled polymers.
---

Title: Michael Bruxner
Content: Le lieutenant-colonel Sir Michael Frederick Bruxner (25 mars 1882 - 28 mars 1970) était un politicien et soldat australien, servant pendant de nombreuses années en tant que chef du Parti country et de ses prédécesseurs. Né à Tabulum, dans le nord de la Nouvelle-Galles du Sud, Bruxner a fait ses études à l'école Armidale et a commencé des études à l'Université de Sydney, mais a ensuite abandonné pour prendre un emploi en tant qu'agent de gâteau et de gare à Tenterfield. Après avoir servi dans les forces militaires citoyennes à partir de 1911, Bruxner s'est enrôlé dans le cheval léger australien lors du déclenchement de la Première Guerre mondiale en 1914. Servant avec distinction à Gallipoli, en Égypte et en Palestine, il a été promu au lieutenant-colonel et a décerné l'ordre de service distingué.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Michael Bruxner
Content: Bruxner started his military career when he was commissioned as a second lieutenant on 11 September 1911 in the 6th Australian (New England) Light Horse, Citizen Military Forces, which was redesignated the 5th the following year. When the First World War broke out in September 1914, Bruxner joined up soon after on 10 October 1914 with the 6th Light Horse Regiment in the Australian Imperial Force. Promoted to captain, Bruxner was sent with his unit to take part in the Gallipoli Campaign, being wounded several times. Later, in 1916, he commanded the 6th during part of the Battle of Romani and served with distinction in the Sinai and Palestine Campaign, for which he was mentioned in despatches twice. On 30 May 1917 was appointed by the President of France, Raymond Poincaré, as a Chevalier of the Légion d'honneur "in recognition of distinguished services during the campaign". Also in 1917, Bruxner was appointed to General Headquarters and rose to be assistant adjutant and quartermaster-general of the ANZAC Mounted Division. For his service he was promoted to lieutenant colonel and appointed as a Companion of the Distinguished Service Order (DSO) in 1919.
---

Title: New York State Route 377
Content: NY 377 begins adjacent to Albany Memorial Hospital at an interchange with US 9 in the city of Albany. The highway initially heads to the northeast as a four-lane, city-maintained road, following Northern Boulevard along the south side of Wolfert's Roost Country Club and the northern edge of a housing tract. After a quarter-mile (0.4 km), the route turns northward onto Van Rensselaer Boulevard, another four-lane street divided by a narrow median. The route runs past two blocks of homes before leaving the Albany city limits and becoming state-maintained as it crosses into the town of Colonie and its village of Menands. Within Menands, NY 377 traverses another mile (1.6 km) of housing tracts before ending at an intersection with NY 378 (Menand Road) northwest of the village center. The northern terminus of NY 377 also serves as the south entrance to Albany Rural Cemetery.

claim: The Young Men’s Christian Association (YMCA) was founded on 6 June 1844 in London by George Williams, who sought to provide wholesome, spiritually focused activities for young men migrating to industrial cities
question_en: When was the YMCA founded?

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: YMCA
Content: Le YMCA a été fondé par George Williams, un drapier de Londres, typique des jeunes hommes attirés par les villes par la révolution industrielle. Lui et ses collègues étaient préoccupés par le manque d'activités saines pour les jeunes hommes dans les grandes villes; Les options disponibles étaient généralement des tavernes et des bordels. L'idée de Williams est née des réunions qu'il tenait pour la prière et la lecture de la Bible parmi ses collègues dans une entreprise de la ville de Londres, et le 6 juin 1844, il a fondé le premier YMCA à Londres dans le but de "l'amélioration de l'état spirituel des jeunes hommes engagés dans la draperie, la broderie et d'autres métiers". En 1851, il y avait des YMCA au Royaume-Uni, en Australie, en Belgique, au Canada, en France, en Allemagne, aux Pays-Bas, en Suisse et aux États-Unis.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: YMCA
Content: The International Coalition of the YMCA Universities brings together universities from all over the world, including Brazil, England, Germany, Hong Kong, India, Mexico, Uruguay, USA, and Venezuela. The universities offer a wide variety of courses on different levels.
Multiple colleges and universities have historically had connections to the YMCA. Springfield College, of Springfield, Massachusetts, was founded in 1885 as an international training school for YMCA Professionals, while one of the two schools that eventually became Concordia University—Sir George Williams College—started from night courses offered at the Montreal YMCA. Northeastern University began out of a YMCA in Boston, and Franklin University began as the YMCA School of Commerce. San Francisco's Golden Gate University traces its roots to the founding of the YMCA Night School on 1 November 1881. Detroit College of Law, now the Michigan State University College of Law, was founded with a strong connection to the Detroit, Michigan YMCA. It had a 99-year lease on the site, and it was only when it expired that the college moved to East Lansing, Michigan. Youngstown State University traces its roots to the establishment of a law school by the local YMCA in 1908. The Nashville School of Law was the YMCA Night Law School until November 1986, having offered law classes since 1911 and the degree of Juris Doctor since January 1927. YMCA pioneered the concept of night school, providing educational opportunities for people with full-time employment. Many YMCAs offer ESL programmes, alternative high school, day care, and summer camp programs. In India, YMCA University of Science and Technology Faridabad was founded in 1969. It offers various programme-related to science and engineering.
---

claim: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs
question_en: How many vertebrae does a human have?
report_en: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs [1].
all_claims: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs [1].
claims_retained: In adults, the human vertebral column contains 24 separate (movable) vertebrae—7 cervical, 12 thoracic, and 5 lumbar—plus two composite bones: the sacrum (formed from five fused vertebrae) and the coccyx (formed from three to five fused vertebrae), giving a total of 26 distinct bones; if every fused segment of the sacrum and coccyx is counted individually, the original number rises to 32–34, which equals the 33 separate vertebrae present at birth before normal fusion occurs [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Squelette axial
Content: À la naissance, la majorité des humains ont 33 vertèbres distinctes. Cependant, pendant le développement normal, plusieurs vertèbres fusionnent ensemble, laissant un total de 24, dans la plupart des cas. La confusion quant à savoir s'il y a ou non 32-34 vertèbres découle du fait que les deux vertèbres les plus basses, le sacrum et le coccyx, sont des os simples composés de plusieurs os plus petits qui ont fusionné ensemble. C'est ainsi que les vertèbres sont comptées: 24 vertèbres distinctes et le sacrum, formées à partir de 5 vertèbres fusionnées et du coccyx, formées à partir de 3 à 5 vertèbres fusionnées. Si vous comptez le coccyx et le sacrum chacun comme une vertèbre, il y a 26 vertèbres. Si les vertèbres fusionnées sont toutes comptées séparément, le nombre total de vertèbres s'élève entre 32 et 34.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Cat anatomy
Content: Cats have seven cervical vertebrae like almost all mammals, thirteen thoracic vertebrae (humans have twelve), seven lumbar vertebrae (humans have five), three sacral vertebrae (humans have five because of their bipedal posture), and, except for Manx cats and other shorter tailed cats, twenty-two or twenty-three caudal vertebrae (humans have three to five, fused into an internal coccyx). The extra lumbar and thoracic vertebrae account for the cat's enhanced spinal mobility and flexibility, compared to humans. The caudal vertebrae form the "tail", used by the cat as a counterbalance to the body during quick movements. Between their vertebrae, they have elastic discs, useful for cushioning the jump landings.
---

Title: Taensa
Content: Le Taensa et le Natchez étroitement apparenté sont des descendants de la culture de la plaquemine préhistorique tardive (1200-1700 CE). La culture de la plaquemine était une variante de culture du Mississippien centrée sur la vallée de la rivière inférieure du Mississippi. Ils avaient des institutions politiques et religieuses complexes et vivaient dans de grands villages centrés sur des monticules de plate-forme de cérémonie. C'étaient principalement des agriculteurs qui ont cultivé du maïs, des citrouilles, des courges, des haricots et du tabac. Ils ont eu une profonde histoire dans la région qui remonte à la précédente Coles Creek (700-1200 CE) et Troyville Cultures (400-700 CE) à la culture de Marksville (100 avant notre ère), qui était contemporain avec les cultures Hopewell de l'Ohio actuel et de l'Illinois.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Taensa
Content: In 1698 French Catholic missionary priests Antoine Davion and François de Montigny and J. B. La Source (a lay person and possible servant to the priests) visited the Taensa; de Montigny founded a short-lived mission among them. De Montigny at that time records their population as being 700 people. In 1699 French explorer Pierre Le Moyne d'Iberville recorded the Taensa as having 300 warriors and living in seven villages named as Taensas, Chaoucoula, Conchayon, Couthaougoula, Nyhougoula, Ohytoucoulas, and Talaspa. The majority of these names are in the Muskogean Mobilian trade language and not the Natchezan Taensa language.

Title: Victor Emmanuel II of Italy
Content: The rest of Victor Emmanuel II's reign was much quieter. After the Kingdom of Italy was established he decided to continue on as King Victor Emmanuel II instead of Victor Emmanuel I of Italy. This was a terrible move as far as public relations went as it was not indicative of the fresh start that the Italian people wanted and suggested that Sardinia-Piedmont had taken over the Italian Peninsula, rather than unifying it. Despite this mishap, the remainder of Victor Emmanuel II's reign was consumed by wrapping up loose ends and dealing with economic and cultural issues. His role in day-to-day governing gradually dwindled, as it became increasingly apparent that a king could no longer keep a government in office against the will of Parliament. As a result, while the wording of the Statuto Albertino stipulating that ministers were solely responsible to the crown remained unchanged, in practice they were now responsible to Parliament.

Elizabeth Blackwell a joué un rôle important aux États-Unis et au Royaume-Uni en tant que réformateur social et moral. Elle a agi comme pionnier dans la promotion de l'éducation des femmes en médecine. Les contributions d'Elizabeth Blackwell restent célébrées par le biais d'une médaille d'Elizabeth Blackwell qui est décernée à une femme chaque année qui a ajouté à la cause de la promotion des femmes en médecine. Title: Fanny Jane Butler
Content: Dr. Fanny Jane Butler (5 October 1850 – 26 October 1889) was a medical missionary from England who was among the first female doctors to travel to India and the first fully trained doctor from England to do so. Prior to her work in Kashmir and other parts of India, Butler was a part of the first class of the London School of Medicine for Women, becoming a member of the forefront of female doctors. Butler spent seven years in India until her death in 1889 and opened medical dispensaries in Srinagar and Bhagalpur, where no medical facilities had previously existed. Butler also initiated the building of the first hospital in Srinagar in 1888 called the John Bishop Memorial Hospital and provided necessary medical care for Indian women, for whom little care had been available.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Taux de feu
Content: Il s'agit de la vitesse d'incendie mécanique, ou de la vitesse à laquelle l'arme "cycles" (charges, verrouillage, incendies, déverrouille, éjecte). La mesure du taux cyclique suppose que l'arme est opérée le plus rapidement possible et ne tient pas compte des tâches de l'opérateur (changements de magazine, visée, etc.). Lorsque la gâchette est appuyée, la vitesse à laquelle des tours sont tirés est le taux cyclique. Les taux cycliques typiques de l'incendie sont de 600 à 900 tr / min pour les fusils d'assaut, 1000-1100 tr / min dans certains cas, 900-1 200 tr / min pour les pistolets et les pistolets machine et 600-1 500 tr / min pour les mitrailleuses. Les miniguns M134 montés sur des hélicoptères d'attaque et d'autres véhicules de combat peuvent atteindre des taux d'incendie de plus de 100 coups par seconde (6 000 tr / min). La vitesse cyclique de feu est le seul taux qui peut être déterminé avec précision.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Fast draw
Content: Fast draw is one of the fastest sports in the world. Every time is measured under one second, from the signal to draw to when the timer is stopped. The current World Fast Draw Association (WFDA) record for Open Class Fast Draw in an event called Standing Balloons is .208 seconds - and that includes the time it takes to react, draw, fire and pop a balloon target at eight feet away. A world class competitor can draw and fire a shot in under half a second. Given that the average human reaction time is around 0.2 to 0.25 seconds, the round is over before most people can react. The reaction times of the best fast draw shooters is 0.145 seconds, which means that the gun is cocked, drawn, aimed (from the hip), and fired in just over 0.06 seconds. To establish a World Fast Draw Association record, a second shot must be fired in the same competition that is no more than 0.30 seconds slower than the first; this is intended to prevent a shot that anticipates the start signal from setting a record. In competitions where two rounds must be fired, at separate targets, less than 0.10 seconds separate the shots.
---

claim: Melioidosis is a recognized infectious disease in humans; its onset may occur years after exposure because the organism can remain dormant, so patients often lack a clear history of soil contact at presentation
question_en: Does melioidosis affect humans?
report_en: Yes. Melioidosis is a recognized infectious disease in humans; its onset may occur years after exposure because the organism can remain dormant, so patients often lack a clear history of soil contact at presentation [1]. Consequently, clinicians are urged to consider melioidosis in any febrile individual who has lived in or returned from endemic regions, highlighting its significance as a human health threat among residents and travellers alike [1].

Content: Un antécédent de contact avec le sol peut ne pas être obtenu, car la mélioidose peut être dormante pendant de nombreuses années avant de se manifester. Document ID: 2
Title: Melioidosis
Content: The single most important risk factor for developing melioidosis is diabetes mellitus, followed by hazardous alcohol use, chronic kidney disease, and chronic lung disease. Other risk factors include thalassaemia, occupation (rice paddy farmers), and cystic fibrosis. The mode of infection is believed to be through either a break in the skin, or the inhalation of aerosolized "B. pseudomallei" cells. Person-to-person spread has been described, but is extremely unusual. HIV infection does not predispose to melioidosis.

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Sismologie de réflexion
Content: L'inventeur canadien Reginald Fessenden a été le premier à concevoir d'utiliser des ondes sismiques réfléchies pour déduire la géologie. Son travail était initialement sur la propagation des ondes acoustiques dans l'eau, motivée par le naufrage du Titanic par un iceberg en 1912. Il a également travaillé sur des méthodes de détection de sous-marins pendant la Première Guerre mondiale. John Clarence Karcher a découvert les réflexions sismiques indépendamment tout en travaillant pour le Bureau des normes des États-Unis (maintenant le National Institute of Standards and Technology) sur des méthodes de sons allant à la détection de l'artillerie. En discussion avec des collègues, l'idée s'est développée que ces réflexions pourraient aider à l'exploration du pétrole. Avec plusieurs autres, beaucoup affiliés à l'Université de l'Oklahoma, Karcher a aidé à former la société d'ingénierie géologique, constituée dans l'Oklahoma en avril 1920. Les premiers tests sur le terrain ont été effectués près d'Oklahoma City, Oklahoma en 1921.

Title: Reflection seismology
Content: Reflection seismology (or seismic reflection) is a method of exploration geophysics that uses the principles of seismology to estimate the properties of the Earth's subsurface from reflected seismic waves. The method requires a controlled seismic source of energy, such as dynamite or Tovex blast, a specialized air gun or a seismic vibrator, commonly known by the trademark name Vibroseis. Reflection seismology is similar to sonar and echolocation. This article is about surface seismic surveys; for vertical seismic profiles, see VSP.
Reflections and refractions of seismic waves at geologic interfaces within the Earth were first observed on recordings of earthquake-generated seismic waves. The basic model of the Earth's deep interior is based on observations of earthquake-generated seismic waves transmitted through the Earth’s interior (e.g., Mohorovičić, 1910). The use of human-generated seismic waves to map in detail the geology of the upper few kilometers of the Earth's crust followed shortly thereafter and has developed mainly due to commercial enterprise, particularly the petroleum industry.

Title: Rugby Road
Content: An integral part of Rugby Road is "Beta Bridge". In the 1850s, a bridge was erected over the Chesapeake and Ohio train tracks in the location of what is now Beta Bridge, but the current structure was built in 1923. The bridge was a part of a citywide paving and improvement project to prepare Charlottesville area streets for the automobile. Although it was originally known simply as the Rugby Road Bridge, when the Beta Theta Pi fraternity built their house at the corner of Chancellor and Rugby in 1927, it took its current name. In 1971, that fraternity location was closed, and the Delta Upsilon fraternity moved into its current location at 180 Rugby Road. As the unofficial monitors of the bridge, brothers and pledges of DU would paint over offensive messages or messages which did not contain 'THX DU' (for "Thanks Delta Upsilon"). In 2011, Beta Theta Pi moved back into their original house next to the bridge, and now messages typically contain 'THX Beta'.

Title: Banksia Menziesii
Content: Décrite pour la première fois par le botaniste Robert Brown au début du 19e siècle, aucune variété distincte de "Banksia menziesii" n'est reconnue. Il se trouve en Australie occidentale, de la région de Perth (32 ° S) au nord jusqu'à la rivière Murchison (27 ° S), et pousse généralement sur des sols sablonneux, dans la vitette ou les bois bas. "Banksia menziesii" fournit de la nourriture pour un large éventail d'animaux d'invertébrés et de vertébrés; Les oiseaux et en particulier les miels sont des visiteurs de premier plan. Une plante relativement rustique, "Banksia menziesii" est couramment observée dans les jardins, les bandes naturelles et les parcs dans les zones urbaines australiennes avec des climats méditerranéens, mais sa sensibilité au dépérissement de la moisissure d'eau transmise par le sol "Phytophthora Cinnamomi" le fait de courte durée dans des endroits avec des étés humides, comme Sydney. "Banksia menziesii" est largement utilisée dans l'industrie des fleurs coupées en Australie et à l'étranger.

Title: Banksia prionotes
Content: During data collection for "The Banksia Atlas" project, a single presumed natural hybrid between "B. prionotes" and "B. lindleyana" (porcupine banksia), with fruit like "B. lindleyana" but leaves intermediate between the two parents, was found north of Kalbarri National Park. At the time this was considered an important discovery, as the parent species were thought not to be closely related. Mast's analyses, however, place them both in a clade of eight species, though "B. lindleyana" remains less closely related to "B. prionotes" than "B. hookeriana". Hybrids of "B. prionotes" with "B. menziesii" (firewood banksia) have also been produced by artificial means, and presumed natural hybrids have been recorded.

Wells dans sa représentation d'un vaisseau spatial lancé sur la lune dans un grand canon. Title: Jean partie
Content: John Part (né le 29 juin 1966) est un joueur et commentateur de fléchettes professionnelles canadiennes, surnommée Dark Maple. Part est un champion du monde trois fois, ayant remporté le championnat du monde BDO 1994, et le championnat du monde PDC en 2003 et 2008. Il est le plus grand joueur de fléchettes d'Amérique du Nord à ce jour. Il a la distinction d'être le premier joueur non-UK à remporter le championnat du monde, et le seul non européen à ce jour à remporter le championnat du PDC World Darts. Son premier championnat était la deuxième fois qu'un joueur non-graine remporte le BDO World Darts Championship, et l'une des rares fois où un joueur n'a perdu qu'un set dans tout le tournoi. Son écart de neuf ans entre ses premier et deuxième championnats du monde est à égalité avec Ted Hankey pour l'écart le plus long entre les championnats du monde, et son troisième triomphe en 2008 l'a vu devenir le premier joueur de l'histoire à remporter un titre mondial dans trois lieux différents, et le premier à gagner au palais d'Alexandra. Sa victoire en 2008 l'a vu rejoindre Phil Taylor, Eric Bristow, Raymond Van Barneveld et John Lowe comme les seuls joueurs avec trois championnats du monde ou plus, et ne deviennent que le deuxième joueur (après Taylor) à remporter plusieurs titres PDC. Ses finales télévisées de PDC télévisées sont à égalité avec Dennis Priestley pour le huitième la plupart du temps, et ses 874 151 £ en prix à ce jour sont le seizième montant le plus élevé de l'histoire du PDC.

A couple of hours after the television appearance, Panzer is found murdered, with Red John's smiley face painted in blood on one of the walls near his body. Content: Les parents les plus proches de Mantises sont les termites et les cafards (Blattodea), qui sont tous dans le SuperOrder Dictyoptera. Les mantes sont principalement des prédateurs d'embuscade, mais quelques espèces vivant au sol poursuivent activement leur proie. Ils vivent normalement pendant environ un an. Dans les climats plus frais, les adultes pondent des œufs en automne, puis meurent. Les œufs sont protégés par leurs capsules dures et l'éclosion au printemps. Les femmes pratiquent parfois le cannibalisme sexuel, mangeant leurs camarades après la copulation.

Title: Statue of Liberty
Content: Originally, the statue was a dull copper color, but shortly after 1900 a green patina, also called verdigris, caused by the oxidation of the copper skin, began to spread. As early as 1902 it was mentioned in the press; by 1906 it had entirely covered the statue. Believing that the patina was evidence of corrosion, Congress authorized for various repairs, and to paint the statue both inside and out. There was considerable public protest against the proposed exterior painting. The Army Corps of Engineers studied the patina for any ill effects to the statue and concluded that it protected the skin, "softened the outlines of the Statue and made it beautiful." The statue was painted only on the inside. The Corps of Engineers also installed an elevator to take visitors from the base to the top of the pedestal.

claim: Yes, a septic tank can explode because the decomposition of sewage produces sewer gas that contains methane and hydrogen sulfide, both highly flammable and potentially explosive; gas ignition can occur if the mixture contacts an open flame or sparks
question_en: Can a septic tank explode?
report_en: Yes, a septic tank can explode because the decomposition of sewage produces sewer gas that contains methane and hydrogen sulfide, both highly flammable and potentially explosive; gas ignition can occur if the mixture contacts an open flame or sparks [1]. Methane levels have been measured up to about 300 ppmv in closed drains just 2 cm above the sewage, significantly higher than the 7–15 ppmv commonly found in open sewers, indicating that enclosed systems like septic tanks can accumulate concentrations high enough to reach their explosive limits if ventilation is inadequate [1].

Title: Tanks of the interwar period
Content: The French used a very wide range of tanks, including many unique types. France was the second largest tank producer in the world, behind the Soviet Union (see French armoured fighting vehicle production during World War II). Their cavalry tank class filled the role of what are now called MBTs. They also fielded a heavy tank design, and several lighter types for scouting and infantry support. In addition to these types, they were also working on super-heavy breakthrough tanks (FCM F1). The French didn't have an independent Tank Corps. All tanks belonged to either the Infantry or the Cavalry.The Renault FT-17 had a long life and saw use in World War II and even later in Indochina. It was utilised as far away as in China, during the Chinese Civil wars, and versions of the tank were used both against and by the Japanese during the invasion of China. A large number found their way into both Republican and Nationalist hands during the Spanish Civil War. They were used in the Russian Revolution by both the Bolsheviks and the White Russians, and later by the Finns against the Soviets. France exported the FT-17 right up to World War II. The design was also developed by the Italians as the Fiat 3000 and the USSR as the T-18.

Ils ont utilisé de nombreuses méthodes complexes, telles que la sublimation des hormones stéroïdes. Une autre méthode spécifiée par les textes chinois - la première datation à 1110 - a spécifié l'utilisation de la saponine (des haricots de "Gleditsia sinensis") pour extraire les hormones, mais le gypse (contenant du sulfate de calcium) a également été utilisé.

Title: Endocrine disruptor
Content: The term "endocrine disruptor" was coined at the Wingspread Conference Centre in Wisconsin, in 1991. One of the early papers on the phenomenon was by Theo Colborn in 1993. In this paper, she stated that environmental chemicals disrupt the development of the endocrine system, and that effects of exposure during development are often permanent.
Although the endocrine disruption has been disputed by some, work sessions from 1992 to 1999 have generated consensus statements from scientists regarding the hazard from endocrine disruptors, particularly in wildlife and also in humans.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Le docteur (Doctor Who)
Content: Le personnage du docteur a été créé par BBC Chef of Drama, Sydney Newman. Le premier document de format pour le programme qui devait devenir "Doctor Who" - puis provisoirement intitulé "The Troubleshooters" - a été écrit en mars 1963 par C. E. Webber, un rédacteur qui avait été amené pour aider à développer le projet. Le document de Webber contenait un personnage principal décrit comme «The Maturer Man, 35–40, avec une« tournure de personnage ». "Newman ne tenait pas à cette idée et - avec plusieurs autres modifications au format initial de Webber - a créé un personnage principal alternatif nommé Dr Who, un homme plus âgé de l'entrejambe pilotant une machine à remonter le temps volée, en fuite de son propre monde lointain. Aucun dossier écrit de la transmission de Newman de ces idées - qui aurait eu lieu en avril 1963 - existe, et le caractère du Dr Who commence pour la première fois dans la documentation existante de mai de la même année.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Doctor Who
Content: There have also been many references to "Doctor Who" in popular culture and other science fiction, including "" ("") and "Leverage". In the Channel 4 series "Queer as Folk" (created by later "Doctor Who" executive producer Russell T. Davies), the character of Vince was portrayed as an avid "Doctor Who" fan, with references appearing many times throughout in the form of clips from the programme. In a similar manner, the character of Oliver on "Coupling" (created and written by current show runner Steven Moffat) is portrayed as a "Doctor Who" collector and enthusiast.
References to "Doctor Who" have also appeared in the young adult fantasy novels "Brisingr" and "High Wizardry", the video game "Rock Band", the Adult Swim comedy show "Robot Chicken", the "Family Guy" episodes "Blue Harvest" and "420", and the game "RuneScape". It has also be referenced in "Destroy All Humans! 2", by civilians in the game's variation of England, and multiple times throughout the "Ace Attorney" series.

claim: The Troubles were an ethno-nationalist conflict in Northern Ireland that began in the late 1960s, is often characterized as a “guerrilla” or “low-level” war, and is generally considered to have concluded with the 1998 Good Friday Agreement
question_en: What are the Troubles?
report_en: The Troubles were an ethno-nationalist conflict in Northern Ireland that began in the late 1960s, is often characterized as a “guerrilla” or “low-level” war, and is generally considered to have concluded with the 1998 Good Friday Agreement [1]. Also known internationally as the Northern Ireland conflict, the violence centred on political and sectarian disputes between mainly Protestant unionists—who wanted Northern Ireland to remain part of the United Kingdom—and mainly Catholic nationalists—who sought unification with the Republic of Ireland; although concentrated in Northern Ireland, the unrest at times spread to the Republic, England, and mainland Europe [1].

The cantilever through-truss consists of two anchor spans each 245 feet in length and the main span 462 feet in length between pier center lines. Title: XETV-TDT
Content: À l'approche de la date de transition de la télévision numérique américaine originale du 17 février 2009, XETV avait exprimé son intention de suivre d'autres stations de la région de San Diego pour cesser la transmission de son signal analogique. Alors que la date limite des États-Unis du 17 février a ensuite été repoussée au 12 juin 2009 et n'a appliqué qu'aux stations sous licence américaine, des plans ont été annoncés pour faire volontairement la programmation en anglais de la station uniquement numérique. Le signal analogique serait réutilisé pour retransmettre le réseau mexicain de Galavisión (à ne pas confondre avec la chaîne câblée américaine du même nom). Les affirmations sur le site Web de XETV selon lesquelles la station allait effectivement transmettre un signal exclusive numérique a été annulée le 17 février 2009 alors que la station décidait de retarder la coupe de son signal analogique jusqu'à ce qu'il ait obtenu l'approbation du gouvernement mexicain. La direction de XETV a déclaré plus tard qu'elle avait décidé de maintenir son signal analogique au profit des téléspectateurs mexicains. Le signal analogique de XETV a finalement été réutilisé le 5 mars 2012, lorsque la station a commencé la multidiffusion sur son signal numérique avec l'ajout du réseau de canal 5 orienté vers la jeunesse de Televisa sur le sous-canal 6.2 et sur son flux analogique, tandis que la chaîne numérique 6.1 a conservé les journaux de nouvelles, le réseau CW et les programmes syndiqués en anglais. À la même date, XHBJ-TV Channel 45 a abandonné le canal 5 pour Galavisión. Canal 5 a remplacé la programmation en anglais de XETV sur son signal analogique, afin de servir les téléspectateurs hispanophones à Tijuana qui n'avaient pas de téléviseurs avec des tuners numériques intégrés ou des boîtes de convertisseur numérique avant la transition 2013 du marché de Tijuana vers la télévision numérique. Le commutateur d'affiliation a coïncidé avec le début de la multidiffusion numérique sur les stations Tijuana de Televisa. Canal 5 a déménagé sur son canal principal le 31 mai 2017, date à laquelle le sous-canal 6.2 a été mis hors service.

Title: XETV-TDT
Content: Because XETV-TDT is licensed to Tijuana by the Mexican government, it is not covered under the FCC's must carry rules. This means that local cable providers are not required to carry XETV-TDT, even if the television station requests to be carried under this provision. As an English-language station XETV had been carried by Cox Communications, Time Warner Cable (now Charter Spectrum) and AT&T U-verse in San Diego, all on channel 6. KFMB-TV's "The CW San Diego" has replaced XETV on the American cable systems, as well as satellite television providers DirecTV and Dish Network. XETV is carried by all Mexican cable systems in its coverage area, as carriage of local broadcast stations is mandated by the Federal Telecommunications Institute (IFT).

Title: History of Bihar
Content: The Gupta Empire had their capital at Pataliputra. The difference between Gupta Empire's and Mauryan Empire's administration was that in the Mauryan administration power was centralised but in the Gupta administration power was more decentralised. The empire was divided into provinces and the provinces were further divided into districts. Villages were the smallest units. The kingdom covered Gujarat, North-East India, south-eastern Pakistan, Odisha, northern Madhya Pradesh and eastern India with capital at Pataliputra, modern Patna. All forms of worship were carried out in Sanskrit.

question_en: How much dopamine is in the human brain?
report_en: Because dopamine is constantly synthesized, released, taken back up and enzymatically degraded, its absolute quantity is not fixed, but biochemical measurements in post-mortem tissue indicate that the entire human brain typically contains only a few milligrams of free dopamine at any moment (well below 0.01 g). This modest pool is maintained by roughly 400,000 dopaminergic neurons whose cell bodies are clustered in six small mid-brain and hypothalamic regions (substantia nigra, ventral tegmental area, posterior hypothalamus, arcuate nucleus, zona incerta and periventricular nucleus, corresponding to groups A8–A14) but whose axons project widely and exert strong modulatory effects across the brain [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Dopamine
Content: Les neurones dopaminergiques (cellules nerveuses productrices de la dopamine) sont relativement peu nombreux - un total d'environ 400 000 dans le cerveau humain - et leurs corps cellulaires sont confinés en groupes à quelques zones cérébrales relativement petites. Cependant, leurs axones se projettent dans de nombreuses autres zones cérébrales, et ils exercent des effets puissants sur leurs cibles. Ces groupes de cellules dopaminergiques ont été cartographiés pour la première fois en 1964 par Annica Dahlström et Kjell Fuxe, qui leur ont attribué des étiquettes en commençant par la lettre "A" (pour "aminergique"). Dans leur schéma, les zones A1 à A7 contiennent le neurotransmetteur noradrénaline, tandis que A8 à A14 contiennent de la dopamine. Les zones dopaminergiques qu'ils ont identifiées sont la substantia nigra (groupes 8 et 9); la zone tegmentale ventrale (groupe 10); l'hypothalamus postérieur (groupe 11); le noyau arqué (groupe 12); la zona incerta (groupe 13) et le noyau périventriculaire (groupe 14).

Title: Schizophreniform disorder
Content: Dopamine is one of the chemicals that carries messages between brain cells. There is evidence that too much dopamine may be involved in the development of schizophrenia, but it’s still not clear how, or whether everyone diagnosed with schizophrenia has too much dopamine. Neuroleptic drugs (antipsychotics), which are sometimes used to treat schizophrenia, target the dopamine system.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Marine japonaise impériale pendant la Seconde Guerre mondiale
Content: Même après la catastrophe de la mer Philippine, l'IJN était toujours une force formidable. Sur les 12 cuirassés disponibles au début de la guerre en 1941-42, neuf sont toujours restés opérationnels, avec 14 des 18 croiseurs lourds d'origine. Cependant, les efforts pour reconstruire la force du transporteur ont échoué, car la formation donnée aux nouveaux aviateurs était de très faible niveau. Par conséquent, les nouveaux transporteurs ne sont jamais allés en mer avec un groupe aérien complet. Cela a laissé les Japonais avec une collection de transporteurs à ragtag, dirigée par le "Zuikaku", qui était le seul survivant de la Force d'attaque de Pearl Harbor. Les Japonais se sont retrouvés avec deux choix, soit pour commettre leur force restante dans une offensive totale, soit pour s'asseoir pendant que les Américains occupaient les Philippines et coupent les voies maritimes entre le Japon et les ressources vitales des Indes orientales et de la Malaisie. Le plan conçu par les Japonais a été une dernière tentative de création d'une bataille décisive en utilisant leur dernière force restante, la puissance de feu de ses lourds croiseurs et cuirassés, qui devaient tous être commis contre la tête de pont américaine à Leyte. Les Japonais prévoyaient d'utiliser leurs transporteurs restants comme appâts, afin d'attirer les transporteurs américains loin de Leyte Gulf assez longtemps pour que les lourds navires de guerre entrent et détruisent tous les navires américains présents.

Title: Naval tactics in the Age of Steam
Content: Shortly after the end of the war, the first aircraft carriers designed from the keel up were completed: the Japanese "Hōshō" and the British "Hermes". Both ships were too small to be satisfactory. 
Under the terms of the Washington Treaty, Britain, America and Japan were allowed to convert two ships that were due to scrap under the treaty into aircraft carriers. By luck as much as planning, the Americans and Japanese both developed large carriers that were capable of handling up to 90 aircraft, based on the hulls of battlecruisers due to be scrapped under the Washington Treaty. Both navies gradually began to develop new tactics for employing aircraft carriers in battle, although these tactics did not come into full fruition until the middle of the Pacific Campaign of WWII.

claim: Supportive care targets the organs most affected: dialysis may be required for acute kidney injury or severe hyperphosphatemia, while calcium carbonate is given orally once serum calcium is checked to control phosphate levels
question_en: Can leptospirosis be cured?
report_en: Yes—because leptospirosis is a bacterial infection, it can usually be cured when diagnosis is prompt and appropriate therapy is started; standard practice is to give effective antibiotics (e.g., doxycycline or penicillin) early and provide supportive measures until the infection and its complications resolve. Supportive care targets the organs most affected: dialysis may be required for acute kidney injury or severe hyperphosphatemia, while calcium carbonate is given orally once serum calcium is checked to control phosphate levels [1]. In patients with pronounced bleeding tendencies, some specialists recommend a short course (7–10 days) of tapering corticosteroids such as prednisolone to curb hemorrhagic inflammation [1]. Outcomes are generally favorable when treatment begins in the first week of illness, with reported case-fatality rates falling below 5 % in high-resource settings; delays, however, allow the bacteria to damage the liver, kidneys, lungs, or heart and can push mortality above 10 %. Therefore, early medical attention and adherence to antibiotic and organ-specific management plans give most patients an excellent chance of full recovery.
all_claims: Yes—because leptospirosis is a bacterial infection, it can usually be cured when diagnosis is prompt and appropriate therapy is started; standard practice is to give effective antibiotics (e.g., doxycycline or penicillin) early and provide supportive measures until the infection and its complications resolve.

Title: Leptospirose
Content: Le traitement de l'hyperphosphatémie consiste à traiter la maladie sous-jacente, la dialyse, le cas échéant, ou l'administration orale de carbonate de calcium, mais pas sans d'abord vérifier les taux sériques de calcium (ces deux niveaux sont liés). L'administration de corticostéroïdes à des doses progressivement réduites (par exemple, la prednisolone) pendant 7 à 10 jours est recommandée par certains spécialistes en cas d'effets hémorragiques graves. Les soins et le traitement spécifiques aux organes sont essentiels dans les cas de rein, de foie ou d'atteinte cardiaque.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Leptospira noguchii
Content: "Leptospira noguchii" is another pathogenic bacteria that causes Leptospirosis. Leptospirosis can be transferred in a multitude of ways. Leptospirosis can transfer from animals to humans (zoonosis), humans to humans, or animals to animals via intake of contaminated body fluids, such as urine and blood. The disease is normally absorbed through the mucosal membranes of another animal or human and is excreted from the body in the urine. The infected individual can be asymptomatic or have very severe symptoms. In serious cases, kidney or liver failure, aseptic meningitis, and fatal pulmonary hemorrhages have occurred in humans.
---

Bilbo inadvertently discovered the Ring's power of invisibility as he fled, allowing him to follow Gollum undetected to a back entrance of the caves. Gollum was convinced that Bilbo knew the way out all along, and hoped to intercept him near the entrance, lest the goblins apprehend Bilbo and find the Ring. Bilbo at first thought to kill Gollum in order to escape, but was overcome with pity, and so merely leaped over him. As Bilbo escaped, Gollum cried out, "Thief, Thief, Thief! Baggins! Document ID: 2
Title: Old Bazaar, Gjakova
Content: According to some statistics in the early 20th century in Gjakova there were 400 craftsmen. The vigorous development of craftsmanship stimulated also the development of trade. "The people of Gjakova have a tendency agriculture, but they are more betrothed to trade. They go to distant places where they open their shops, inns etc. to provide for their living" was written in the yearbook (salname) of the vilayet of Kosova in 1887. The Gjakovar traders and craftsmen used to sell their product not only in Grand Bazaar, but also in many markets in other towns of Ottoman Empire, of Serbia and Austria. According to the facts, in the 1720s, the traders of Pristina and Gjakova transported their goods firstly to Dubrovnik and then to Italy. In 1803 the trader (merchant) from Gjakova, Jonuz Spahiu, had sold 114 bales of small leathers in Venice. In 1827 Salih Gjakova and Kërsto Gjakova sent gunpowder, rifles and flint stone to Sarajevo, whilst a year later, Hasan Gjakova and his nephew Hamza sent three bales of rifles to Serbia. According to the minutes of customs duty (cymryks) of Pozhega, of Aleksinac, of Kragujevac, of Mokra Gora, of Belgrade, etc., the traders from Gjakova sold their goods such as silk galloons, tobacco, rice, maize, eels, razors, soles, double-barrel sporting rifles, pistols, long rifles, cartridges, gunpowder, flint stones, wax, snuff, different leathers, salt, oil, cotton, cotton breast collars, cotton ribbons, silver galloons, scarfs, figs etc. Ali Sulejmani from Gjakova, in 1837, transported 56 loads of sheep leathers and other goods in an amount of 283.38 groshes, through Belgrade to Austria whereas in 1841, Halil Dobruna transported through Serbia to Austria galloons in an amount of 1800 groshes and 21,5 loads of Morocco leather (saftjan).

Title: Dimetrodon
Content: Besides its small size, "D. milleri" differs from other species of "Dimetrodon" in that its neural spines are circular rather than figure-eight shaped in cross-section. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Histoire de la psychologie
Content: La psychologie était une branche du domaine de la philosophie jusqu'aux années 1870, lorsqu'elle s'est développée comme une discipline scientifique indépendante en Allemagne et aux États-Unis. La psychologie en tant que domaine conscient de l'étude expérimentale a commencé en 1879, à Leipzig Allemagne, lorsque Wilhelm Wundt a fondé le premier laboratoire dédié exclusivement à la recherche psychologique en Allemagne. Wundt a également été la première personne à se qualifier de "psychologue". Les autres premiers contributeurs importants au domaine sont Hermann Ebbinghaus (un pionnier dans l'étude de la mémoire), William James (le père américain du pragmatisme) et Ivan Pavlov (qui a développé les procédures associées au conditionnement classique).
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Clinical psychology
Content: The field began to organize under the name "clinical psychology" in 1917 with the founding of the American Association of Clinical Psychology. This only lasted until 1919, after which the American Psychological Association (founded by G. Stanley Hall in 1892) developed a section on Clinical Psychology, which offered certification until 1927. Title: Red-eared firetail
Content: The red-eared firetail ("Stagonopleura oculata"), also known as the boorin, is a small finch-like species of bird. It occurs in dense wetland vegetation of coastal to sub-coastal regions in Southwest Australia. Its appearance is considered appealing, with white spots, black barring and vivid crimson marks at the ear and upper tail. Red-eared firetails are usually only glimpsed briefly, if at all, as they move rapidly and discreetly through their habitat. Most observations occur when their soft voice is heard, or in flight when flushed from the dense scrub. Males and females are similar in colouring and bond as lifelong pairs that occupy a territory centred on their roosting and brooding nest site. The species occupy a similar ecological niche to the beautiful firetail "Stagonopleura bella" found in the east of Australia, although unlike other species of the genus they only occasionally group together and are almost never seen in large flocks.

Content: Caraga, officially known as the Caraga Administrative Region or simply Caraga Region and designated as Region XIII, is an administrative region in the Philippines occupying the northeastern section of the island of Mindanao. The Caraga Region was created through "Republic Act No. 7901" on February 23, 1995. The region comprises five provinces: Agusan del Norte, Agusan del Sur, Surigao del Norte, Surigao del Sur and Dinagat Islands; six cities: Bayugan, Bislig, Butuan, Cabadbaran, Surigao and Tandag; 67 municipalities and 1,311 barangays. Butuan is the regional administrative center.
